summary:
What makes a great entertainment professional? Dedication, reliability, and the creativity to bring vision to reality. With over a decade of professional experience working hands on with corporate event production, content creation, and marketing, I will be able to bring your corporate events or internal content to the next level. From initial planning to the big screen, I can assist in every step of the process, telling the story of your company and making the most out of the presentation medium.

I thoroughly believe in going the extra mile for satisfaction, and with dual experience in both content production and practical live event production I will be able to coordinate with both the event planners to create striking, eye-catching content, as well as the technical directors on the production to assure they have what they need for smooth playback as well as how to best utilize their set up. Whether it be a streaming, a video wall, or a 120’ projection surface, I will step out of the box to wow your audience!

I’ve created over 30 high quality commercials for a variety of businesses and organizations throughout New York and New Jersey. Spots include both live action and motion graphic commercials, and my goal is to make the production process as painless as possible for my clients. I firmly believe that through video, anything is possible, and when you have me on your project, you can rest assured that I will bring your vision to life!

headline: I name things.
occupation: I name things.
positions/0/description:
I hate terrible brand names. It’s my cause to make sure you don’t have one. I take comfort knowing that I’ve introduced hundreds of names to the world that people genuinely enjoy. 

Best of all, wonderful names work wonders for business. 

Drawn from my career, these are the kinds of names I strive for:

Tonal digital fitness system
Humantold
Mythic AI
Rather Outdoors
Fitbit Sense
Plume 
Pattern Energy
Turntide Technologies
Adobe Lightroom
Wanderful Storybooks
Amples cryptocurrency
Utmost
Lyric hearing aid
Zoa biofabricated leather
Dreyer’s Slow-Churned ice cream
Glint
Run Brain Run
Qualcomm Snapdragon
Yum! Brands
Quell wearable pain relief
Scribe Winery
Rapt Studio

Beyond name creation, I have 30 years under my belt developing naming strategies, nomenclature and architecture systems, and taglines such as:

Love is a four-legged word (Whole Paws)
Make Now Yours (Pause relaxation drink)
Energy for Generation (Pattern Energy)
#VoteForYourLife 

My perspective is uniquely holistic, informed by a career unlike any other. I’m an award-winning linguist and expert in computational linguistics. I’ve been a photomechanical typesetter, software product manager and marketer, ad copywriter, and paste-up artist. 

Prior to establishing my agency, Operative Words, I was Global Director of Naming & Writing at Landor Associates and a namer at Lexicon Branding. 

The New York Times Magazine wrote a feature story about my work. BBC News tells me 100 million people watched my interview on naming best practices. You’ll find that press on OperativeWords.com, as well as my portfolio, process, and blog where I share my expertise to help everyone become a great namer or great judge of names.

I’d like you to hire me, but if you don’t, please make damn well sure you end up with a great name. You — and the world — deserve nothing less.
positions/1/description: Oversight of all verbal branding work for Landor globally. Worldwide naming knowledge leader. Day-to-day responsibility for Landor San Francisco naming & writing practice. Creative and strategic direction and development of messaging, new product concepts, naming, positioning and brand essence programs. Verbal branding press spokesman. New business and P&L responsibility. Brainstorming go-to guy.
positions/2/description: Name research and development. Clients included P&G, Subaru, Coca-Cola, Adobe, Wyeth, Lilly, Liberate, Johnson & Johnson, Novell, Pfizer, et al.
positions/3/description:
Directed all marketing communications
Oversee advertising
Press spokesman
User group liaison
Marketing lead for all products
StuffIt product manager (1 yr.)
positions/4/description: Develop and implement graphic design services for statewide premium wine distributor.
summary:
I hate terrible brand names. It’s my cause to make sure you don’t have one. I take comfort knowing that I’ve introduced hundreds of names to the world that people genuinely enjoy. 

As long as brand names are foisted on us, wouldn’t you rather they be beautiful and not verbal blight?

Best of all, wonderful names work wonders for business. 

Drawn from my career, these are the kinds of names I strive for:

Tonal digital fitness system
Humantold
Mythic AI
Rather Outdoors
Fitbit Sense

Rich Pageant
Adobe Lightroom

Dreyer’s Slow-Churned ice cream
Hardcraft Industries
Glint
Run Brain Run
Qualcomm Snapdragon
Yum! Brands
Quell wearable pain relief
Scribe Winery
Rapt Studio

Beyond name creation, I have 30 years under my belt developing naming strategies, nomenclature and architecture systems, and taglines such as:

Love is a Four-Legged Word (Whole Paws)
Make Now Yours (Pause relaxation drink)
Food for the Fun of It (Frito-Lay)
Energy for Generations (Pattern Energy)
#VoteForYourLife 

My perspective is uniquely holistic, informed by a career unlike any other. I’m an award-winning linguist and expert in computational linguistics. I’ve been a photomechanical typesetter, software product manager and marketer, ad copywriter, and paste-up artist. 

Prior to establishing my agency, Operative Words, I was Global Director of Naming & Writing at Landor Associates and a namer at Lexicon Branding. At Landor, I directed the naming of Accenture, perhaps the largest renaming effort in history. 

The New York Times Magazine wrote a feature story about my work. BBC News confirmed over 100 million views of my interview on naming best practices. Checkout more media mentions on OperativeWords.com, as well as my portfolio, process, and blog where I share my expertise to help everyone become a great namer or great judge of names.

I’d like you to hire me, but if you don’t, please make damn well sure you end up with a great name. You — and the world — deserve nothing less.

headline: Professor of Ethics in Medicine and Health Technologies at Technical University of Munich
jobTitle: Professor of Ethics in Medicine and Health Technologies
occupation: Professor of Ethics in Medicine and Health Technologies at Technical University of Munich
positions/0/description: Director, Institute of History and Ethics in Medicine
positions/0/title: Professor of Ethics in Medicine and Health Technologies
positions/1/description:
I lead the Emmy Noether Research Group Political Philosophie and Bioethics, formerly at the University of Muenster, now at Kiel University.

Political philosophy has informed bioethical debates for several decades, for example in the discussions about the just allocation of health care resources or about the normative foundations of public health. This has sometimes happened implicitly and there is a lack of systematic analysis of how concepts and theories of political philosophy have been used to build arguments for particular policy applications in bioethics, and whether this has happened in a consistent way. 

The Emmy Noether Research Groups looks across a number of issues and discussions in bioethics and examines how political philosophy has played out in these areas. Based on this horizontal analysis, it seeks to develop well-argued policy proposals for ongoing bioethical debates. Exemplary fields of inquiry are theories of justice and priority setting in medicine and health care; the different normative justifications of public health and health promotion policies; concepts of the person and enhancement; and solidarity in contemporary bioethical applications.

For contacts and more information, see website below.
positions/1/title: Head of Emmy Noether Research Group
positions/2/description: Most of my current research involves interdisciplinary and collaborative work on ethical, social, societal and regulatory issues in modern biomedicine. I lead a research group on the application of modern political philosophy to bioethical challenges and have ongoing projects on emerging forms of biomedical research and participatory medicine; solidarity in bioethics and beyond; various issues in public health; questions of fair rationing; ethical challenges in sports medicine; and ethical issues in transplantation. In my research, I enjoy working with a wide range of other professions, including philosophers, political theorists, social scientists, lawyers, and clinicians. My teaching covers the whole field of biomedical ethics. I do clinical ethics consulting at my University hospital, chair its Medical Governance Commission and IRB, and offer research ethics advisory (e.g. for EU consortia). Nowadays I also sit on all these other committees, but then some of them have actual influence on policy making, and that delights me, since ultimately, I am looking to develop well-argued recommendations for ethical policy and practice.
positions/3/description: I work at the UCL School of Public Policy on issues of political philosophy and bioethics, such as the project on social values in health care commissioning.
positions/4/description:
I advise and continue some of the work I have done at the Council by being part of ongoing projects, giving talks, hosting meetings etc., in particular on the ethics of biofuels; novel neurotechnologies; and solidarity in bioethics.
For contacts and projects, see the NCOB website below.
summary:
Alena is Professor of Ethics in Medicine and Health Technologies and Director of the Institute of History and Ethics in Medicine, Technical University Munich. With a background in medicine, philosophy and sociology, Alena works on a wide range of topics in the ethics of medicine and health technologies. She has piloted the Munich Embedded Ethics and Social Science Approach and, together with many colleagues, is devoted to implementing it wider into Health technology development. 

Alena was chair of the German Ethics Council 2020-2024 and currently sits on a number of advisory bodies, including for the German Government. She has received various awards and honors for her public engagement and her research.

She will publish a book on Medical Ethics for a wider public at end of March 2025 (see link in bio for preorders).

headline: VP, Generative AI @ Adobe | Firefly models, applied research and APIs
jobTitle: VP, Generative AI and Sensei - Firefly family of models
occupation: VP, Generative AI @ Adobe | Firefly models, applied research and APIs
positions/0/description:
As the Vice President responsible for Adobe’s Firefly family of Generative AI models, I lead the development and integration of cutting-edge AI capabilities into our creative tools. Firefly is powered by the our Sensei platform, which manages curated AI training data, distributed training pipelines, and large-scale inference infrastructure for all Adobe AI researchers.

Collaborating closely with Adobe Research labs, the Firefly team productizes professional-grade Generative AI models for content creation and editing. We are also pioneering agentic experiences through dialog-based user interfaces, as well as exploring next-generation paradigms such as neural document formats.

Our AI Training Data team builds and curates comprehensive, ethically sourced datasets that support the development of models across a wide range of document types—from images and videos to text, vectors, and 3D.

The Sensei platform serves as our “AI Superhighway,” driving technology transfer and efficiency across Adobe’s research groups by streamlining distributed model training, GPU cluster utilization, and model optimization for both cloud-based and on-device execution.
positions/0/title: VP, Generative AI and Sensei - Firefly family of models
positions/1/description:
Responsible for executing the Services strategy for Creative Cloud(CC): engagement (CC home and "first mile" onboarding), Cloud documents and CC Spaces, Design systems with CC Libraries, Extensibility, Fonts and Neural Filters. UI components, native and web SDKs and supporting micro-services integrated in Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign, Spark, Premiere, After Effects, Bridge,  etc

• Leading a cross-functional, geo-distributed team of 300+ - partnering CC app teams, Adobe Design and Adobe Research.
•  Lead the Cloud Documents strategy - enabling designer to designer collaboration by sharing documents in the cloud, with optimized sync, versioning and desktop/mobile/web access
•  Lead the CC Review capabilities - enabling designer to stakeholder collaboration in our applications - using in app and web commenting, invitation components and email notifications.
•  Building a Design System with CC Libraries - helping teams of designers scale with brand guidelines
•  Supporting Adobe Fonts - making ~20000 high quality fonts accessible to all CC customers with deep integration in all creative apps
•  Delivering the Universal Extensibility Platform - enabling the creation of native user experiences in our desktop products by 1st party and 3rd party developers. Similar to React Native but adapted for Adobe apps and platforms, and implementing our Adobe apps design language (Spectrum).
•  Building Neural Filters - enabling AI powered based plugins in our applications to scale Adobe magic creation and accelerate machine learning tech transfer from Adobe Research.
•  Leading the team building a new on-boarding UI (“first-mile experience”) for millions of new Creative Cloud customers interacting with our applications (from Photoshop to Adobe XD). The new experience, powered by machine-learning, enables personalized and app-specific workflows based on individual user’s context and intent.
positions/2/description: Responsible for executing the Services strategy for Creative Cloud: engagement (cc web and "first mile" onboarding), cloud documents and projects, design systems with libraries, extensibility and fonts. UI components, SDKs and supporting micro-services integrated in Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign, Premiere, After Effects, Bridge, etc
positions/3/description:
Responsible for Digital Imaging Services strategy, enabling cloud photo storage for Lightroom CC and Lightroom Web and improving onboarding for photography customers.

• Leading a team of 50+ cloud and web engineers - partnering with the Photoshop and Lightroom teams
• Partnered with Adobe design to explore the re-invention of the Lightroom CC UI iterating on a live Electron prototype
• Drove the scalability improvements for our AWS based cloud storage to enable the launch of Lightroom CC with RAW photo support. COGS analysis and planning.
• Single digit increased conversion for Creative Cloud Photography Plan by improving the web onboarding flow and using in-browser application deployments.
• Started machine learning based exploration of photo auto-tagging and auto-edit in Adobe Camera Raw and Lightroom
• Pioneered webassembly (pnacl/emscripten) deployments of large Adobe codebases on the web.
• Built Torq, an internal JavaScript framework similar to React.js designed for high-complexity UI applications that was used in 20+ projects in Adobe (we ended up moving to React to benefit from the open source community)
• Innovated in the desktop application space by extending Electron with GPU capabilities to support hybrid (web + native) application development on desktop. Technology powering Adobe Dimension.
• Advisor for Digital Imaging leadership on mobile and web strategy, focused on funnel conversion and customer workflow optimization.
positions/3/title: Sr. Director, Digital Imaging and Product Strategy
positions/4/description:
Running Adobe Romania, focusing on next generation web products development and research.

• Contributed to the strategy around Adobe's foray in DIgital Marketing, part of the Omniture technical due-dilligence team and integration with Creative Suite
• Contributed to the Adobe reinvention in the web space, driving the first HTML5 Webkit contribution efforts taking Adobe page layout technologies and making them open source (CSS Regions).
• Grew the site from 30 to ~500 people, focused mostly on building next generation products in the web and services space - from Web Content Management to Video Analytics and Adobe Oauth services.
• Several times winner of Best Company to Work for in Romania.
• One Patent in Intelligent Ads with client side targeting
summary:
As the Vice President of Generative AI at Adobe, I lead a global team of over 300 applied researchers and engineers developing and integrating Firefly generative AI models into our creative tools. I oversee the AI platform, providing curated training data, distributed training pipelines, and large-scale inference technologies for Adobe Research and Applied Research.

My mission is to enable creative professionals and enthusiasts to bring their visions to life through the transformative power of AI. With more than two decades of experience spanning web development, digital imaging, product strategy, cloud services, and machine learning, I bring a holistic perspective to driving innovation. Previously, I founded InterAKT, a web tools company acquired by Adobe, and led Adobe Romania for a decade. I remain passionate about the impact of machine learning and the limitless opportunities it creates for collaboration and growth.

headline: CEO and R&D director at Numalis
honors/0/description:
Lors de son université d’été le MEDEF remet un prix de l’innovation à la startup Numalis 

Le MEDEF est souvent reconnu pour son rôle auprès des grands groupes mais cette année les startups y ont fait une entrée remarquée. Avec le soutien de l’accélérateur de startups Starburst et du GICAT (groupement des industries de la Défense Française) s’est déroulé la première édition du concours nationale de l’innovation pour primer les startups les plus innovantes ayant des applications civiles et militaires.
Remis par M. Geoffroy Roux de Bezieux, vice-président délégué du MEDEF, ce prix récompense des entreprises qui innovent à la fois dans le monde civil et militaire.
honors/1/description: NETVA est organisé par les Services pour la Science et la Technologie de l’Ambassade de France aux Etats Unis et de l’Ambassade de France au Canada, en partenariat avec Business France. Le programme s’appuie sur le soutien de partenaires tels que RETIS, le réseau des incubateurs français, et Microsoft BizSpark. Le programme implique au total une trentaine de partenaires en France, aux Etats-Unis et au Canada.
honors/2/description: L’ordre des experts comptables a organisé le 3 décembre la 12ème édition le prix Cré’Acc pour récompenser les initiatives d’entrepreneurs régionaux. Et cette année c’est Numalis qui a remporté le prix « coup de cœur » du jury composé de spécialistes du financement et de la gestion d’entreprise.
honors/3/description: Dans sa catégorie, Graine d’entrepreneur en économie productive, Numalis a décroché l’un des lauréats. En effet, toute catégorie confondues, près de 300 candidatures ont été reçues pour seulement 14 lauréats ! Tel était le challenge de la 3ème édition du prix « Coup de pousse » organisé par la région Languedoc-Roussillon
honors/4/description: La 16ième édition du concours s’est déroulée le 24 avril à Montpellier pour récompenser les jeunes startups les plus prometteuses du Languedoc-Roussillon. Numalis fait partie des 8 lauréats (en catégorie émergence) sélectionnés par un jury composé de professionnels de la création d’entreprise et BPI France.
honors/4/issuer: Ministère de l'enseignement supérieur et de la recherche
honors/4/title: Lauréat au Concours National d'Aide à la Création d'Entreprise de Technologies Innovantes, en catégorie "Émergence"
honors/5/description:
Pour sa première édition, le prix AEF docteurs-entrepreneurs a été décerné lors des RUE (rencontres universités-entreprises), vendredi 21 mars 2014, à Xavier Duportet (projet PhageX), Arnault Ioualalen (Numalis) et François Mériaux (Spraed). Chaque lauréat bénéficiera d'un double parrainage : par un responsable R&D d'entreprise membre du club "recherche et innovation" d’AEF, et par un entrepreneur de sa région identifié par le Medef. 
Une centaine de candidatures ont été reçues à ce concours, qui entend "réaffirmer qu’au-delà de leurs indéniables compétences en recherche scientifique, les jeunes docteurs créent aussi de la valeur"

headline: Founder and CEO at Cerebras Systems
occupation: Founder and CEO at Cerebras Systems
positions/0/description: Cerebras Systems builds the fastest AI accelerators in the industry. Optimized for inference and for training, our solutions are based on our processor called the Wafer Scale Engine (WSE). The WSE is the largest and fastest processor ever built.  Our solutions are available in the cloud and on premise and are used by leading institutions around the world including but not limited to:  GSK, G42, AstraZeneca, Abbvie, TotalEnergies, Jasper, nference, Argonne National Laboratory, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Pittsburgh Supercomputing Center, Leibniz Supercomputing Centre, National Center for Supercomputing Applications, Edinburgh Parallel Computing Centre (EPCC), National Energy Technology Laboratory, and Tokyo Electron Devices.
positions/1/description:
In February 2012, AMD acquired SeaMicro, where I was founder and CEO, for $355 million dollars. The SeaMicro team became the Data Center Server Solutions business unit inside of AMD. 

At AMD, I led two business units: Data Center Server Solutions as well as Server CPUs.  Together, these businesses designed extraordinary CPUs, communication fabrics, and server systems. The goal was to transform the data center by developing products that are easier to use, and consume a fraction of the power and space of traditional devices.
positions/1/title: Corporate Vice President and General Manager
positions/2/description:
SeaMicro was acquired by AMD in 2012 for $355 million.

SeaMicro transformed the data center by building servers that drew one-quarter the power and took one-quarter the space of traditional servers. By delivering breakthrough innovations borne of multiple technology domains – CPU design, virtualization, supercomputing and networking – SeaMicro created a new server architecture purpose-built for scale out infrastructures such as those found in the web-tier, online gaming, search and index computation.
summary:
I am a one of the founders and am CEO of Cerebras Systems. We are a team of pioneering computer architects, computer scientists, deep learning researchers, and engineers of all types. We have come together to build a new class of computer to accelerate artificial intelligence work by three orders of magnitude beyond the current state of the art. Our flagship product, the CS-3,  is the fastest AI computer in existence. It contains a collection of industry firsts, including the Cerebras Wafer Scale Engine (WSE-3). The WSE-3 is the largest chip ever built. It contains 4 trillion transistors and covers more than 46,225 square millimeters of silicon. The largest competitor's processor is only 80 billion transistors and covers 815 square millimeters. In artificial intelligence work, large chips process information more quickly producing answers in less time. As a result, neural networks that in the past took months to train, can now train in minutes and models that take tens of seconds to serve can be served immediately. 

Prior to co-founding Cerebras Systems, I was co-founder and CEO of SeaMicro.  SeaMicro (acquired by AMD for $355 million) was the pioneer in low power server technology. SeaMicro changed the trajectory of the server industry by inventing the high density, lower power, microserver category.

Prior to co-founding SeaMicro, I was Vice President of Marketing and Product Management at Force10 (acquired by Dell for $800 Million) Networks, and Vice President of Corporate Marketing and Corporate Development for Riverstone Networks (NASDAQ: RSTN) from inception through IPO. 

My passion is building teams that solve hard problems. Together we recognize large emerging opportunities, listen closely to customer requirements, build industry transforming products, and then bring these products to market in compelling fashion.

summary: Bart de Witte is a leading and distinguished expert for digital transformation in healthcare in Europe, but also one of the most progressive thought leaders in his field. He focuses on developing alternative strategies for creating a more desirable future for the post-modern world, and for all of us. He is the initiator of the non-profit organization, HIPPO AI Foundation, located in Berlin. This non-profit aims to building a foundation for a sustainable and equitable society by accelerating open source AI. In 2020, Bart de Witte and his Hippo AI foundation, were selected as a finalist for the prestigious falling walls conference as breakthrough of the year in the category of Engineering and Technology. Bart's mission is to accelerate innovation while decreasing R&D costs and increasing access to life saving discoveries. He focuses on shifting the healthcare industry towards open technologies, open data and AI standards, and interoperability. He is a strong advocate of equity, diversity and sustainability. He expressed his interest in artificial intelligence when he wrote his first paper on the topic in 1989 and reiterated his interest again when he began working at IBM, back in 2010. He is an advisor to several Fortune Global 500 companies and startups specializing in digital health, and lectures frequently at various business universities in Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Austria and China. Bart de Witte is a fellow at the Institute for Exponential Technologies and Desirable Futures, futur.io and holds degrees from various universities in Belgium and has pursued several other post-university paths at national and international business schools, including Harvard Business School.

summary:
Bernhard Pflugfelder has 10+ experience in the fields of information retrieval, data science, natural language processing (NLP), Data and AI across different industries such as Automotive , Information Services, Media & Entertainment. Over the years, he worked with and enjoyed very different organizations and roles from startups, over consultancy to industry companies. 

At BMW Group, Bernhard founded and lead an NLP / AI product and expert team worked on AI solutions and technologies with businesses and stakeholders across the whole company. Additionally, Bernhard was also member of a company-wide AI Strategy core team with focus of actively shape the AI Transformation of BMW Group and scale AI technology and applications in products and processes. Apart from his focus on AI, he was an initial member of a Quantum Computing expert group prepared the foundations for a later more broader activities of BMW Group in Quantum Computing. 

Bernhard's skills are quite diverse and focusing both technological and methodological solutions. He collected experience with Big Data, Advanced Analytics and Data Science as well as NLP and AI in general. He always enjoys new challenges and is continuously working on learning and growing personally. Working with excellent teams is key for this.

The most favorite area of Bernhard is NLP. Current research and development on foundation models (e.g. large language models) supporting machine learning techniques such as self-supervised or zero/few shot learning are amazing and inspiring. 
Derived by these promising developments in AI, Bernhard’s mission at applied AI is to leverage such new methods and technology together with applied Ai’s partners surrounded by defining sustainable, corporate AI strategy approaches and use case roadmaps to really make an impact.

headline: VP, Innovation
occupation: VP, Innovation
positions/1/description:
Dade Orgeron has been building virtual worlds for over 25 years. He has worked as a 3D Designer, Art Director, Creative Director, 3D Director and mentor - helping 3D artists hone the skills they need to become masters of their craft. He spent the first part of his career in advertising and title design for film and television working on numerous award winning campaigns for Honda, Microsoft, Autodesk, HBO, Showtime, Verizon, Sprint, NASCAR, Nickelodeon, and more. Early on, his ability to conjure unique and amazingly detailed 3D worlds elevated him as pioneer in the newly developing field of motion graphics and 3D design. 

In 2013, Dade joined TurboSquid to help build and curate the world’s largest 3D content library and to bring 3D models to an even wider audience of non-3D users. Since then, his focus has been to simplify the overtly technical challenges facing 3D artists by developing standards, tools, and training that allow artists to focus more on the creative side of 3D content creation. With a deep understanding of industry trends and tools that are driving 3D processes, he continues to work with many of the biggest names in the 3D space to assure that 3D content adheres to the latest industry requirements and workflows. 

Now at Shutterstock, his vision for feeding content to the Metaverse gains even greater focus as he looks toward harnessing AI and ML technologies to help 3D content creators build, conform, manage, and distribute their 3D content. It’s not enough to simply make great looking 3D models, 3D artists need build 3D content that is truly flexible enough to work in all the new and amazing platforms being developed… as well as applications far into the future. Right now is the most amazing time to be in the 3D content creation game, and it’s getting even more exciting every day.
positions/3/description: PixelSquid.com is geared specifically for expert level graphic designers. It offers stock imagery generated from 3D models, which provides designers with an advanced Photoshop file of an object at their selected angle that includes layered lighting, masking, shadow and depth layer control.
positions/4/description:
TurboSquid is the leading source for professional 3D models which are used by game developers, news agencies, architects, visual effects studios, advertisers, and creative professionals from around the world.

TurboSquid's secondary mission is to focus the creativity of artists around the world to continually improve the quality of 3D models available to professionals, while helping the artists who supply them to build a career as professional 3D modelers.
summary:
Dade Orgeron has been a creative technologist for over 25 years, emerging as part of the first wave of designers leveraging 3D technology to pioneer new storytelling techniques. His career has seen him rise from 3D designer to Creative Director, where he crafted award-winning ad campaigns, film titles, and game trailers. In 2013, he joined TurboSquid to lead the expansion and curation of the world’s largest 3D content library, where he developed innovative standards, tools, and training that made it easier for 3D artists to overcome technical challenges. 

Now Vice President of Innovation at Shutterstock, Dade leads the company’s generative AI strategy, helping to design and develop transformative tools that are once again reshaping content creation workflows across industries. His leadership extends to forging strategic partnerships with some of the world’s leading tech companies, playing a key role in shaping the future of creative content. Driven by a commitment to ethical AI, Dade ensures that generative AI models and tools empower creators, allowing them to safely harness these technologies to expand their capabilities and unlock their creative potential.

It includes legal-specific capabilities such as OCR engines and legal dictionaries, as well as connectors for language models like GPT-3. The OS is intended to be a purpose-built platform specifically designed for the legal industry, with an emphasis on compliance with information security standards and data protection laws. It is expected to be available in 2023 and is intended to help legal organizations increase productivity and better leverage data.    LEARN MORE at Kelvin.Legal

positions/2/description:
Founder & Director  at The Law Lab @ Illinois Tech - Chicago Kent College of Law 
The Law Lab is a premier interdisciplinary teaching and research center focused on legal innovation and technology.  As part of the Illinois Tech - Chicago-Kent College of Law, a law school with a rich history of scientific and technological research as well as leveraging new classroom technology to maximize student learning, The Law Lab is poised to provide a unique academic experience.  Situated in Illinois Tech’s downtown campus, which houses the law school, the Stuart School of Business, and the Institute of Design, The Law Lab is optimally positioned for truly collaborative work.  Law, technology, finance, science, and design converge at The Law Lab.
https://www.thelawlab.com/
positions/3/description: Daniel manages Elevate’s data analytics and artificial intelligence (AI) strategy. He assists in both internal and customer efforts to infuse data science and AI into existing work streams. This includes supporting not only the customer’s technical requirements but also the associated education and change management. Prior to joining Elevate, Daniel was the Co-Founder and Chief Strategy Officer at LexPredict–a legal technology and analytics company which was acquired by Elevate in November 2018.
summary:
Professor Katz is a scientist, technologist and professor who applies an innovative polytechnic approach to teaching law - to help create lawyers for today's biggest societal challenges.  Both his scholarship and teaching integrate science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Professor Katz's forward-thinking ideas helped to earn him acknowledgement among the Fastcase 50, an award which "recognizes 50 of the smartest, most courageous innovators, techies, visionaries, and leaders in the law."  He was also named to the American Bar Association Journal's "Legal Rebels," a prestigious group of change leaders in the legal profession.

Professor Katz teaches a variety of courses at Illinois Tech Chicago-Kent Law and spearheads new initiatives to teach law students how to leverage technology and entrepreneurship in their future legal careers.  Professor Katz has published or forthcoming work in a wide variety of academic outlets, including Science, Plos One, Scientific Reports, Journal of the Royal Society Interface, Journal of Statistical Physics, Frontiers in Physics, Physica A and Artificial Intelligence & Law. In addition, his work has been published in legal journals including Cornell Journal of Law & Public Policy, Emory Law Journal, Virginia Tax Review, Iowa Law Review, Illinois Law Review, Ohio State Law Journal, Journal of Law & Politics, and Journal of Legal Education. Professor Katz is currently working on two book projects including an edited volume entitled Legal Informatics (Cambridge University Press 2021).

His work has been highlighted in a number of media outlets, including the New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, BBC Radio, Wired, Vox, National Public Radio and many others.   

Professor Katz is actively involved in the rapidly growing legal technology industry.  He is the Co-Founder & Chief Strategy Officer of LexPredict (a legal technology and analytics company that was acquired by Elevate in 2018).   He also serves as a formal and informal advisor to a number of legal tech startups.  In addition, he is a member of the advisory board of NextLaw Labs - a global collaborative innovation ecosystem organized with Dentons (the world’s largest law firm). 

PAGE:   DanielMartinKatz.com  https://www.danielmartinkatz.com/ 
BLOG:   ComputationalLegalStudies.com  https://computationallegalstudies.com/

occupation: Founder and CEO, insitro (we're hiring!). Co-founder, Coursera. Professor of CS & Pathology at Stanford (now adjunct).
positions/0/description: Modern medicine has given us therapies for many diseases, but it's becoming consistently more challenging to develop new ones. The drug development process involves multiple steps, each of which involves a complex experiment that often fails. We believe that, for many of these phases, we can develop machine learning models to help predict the outcome of these experiments, and that those models, while inevitably imperfect, will outperform predictions based on traditional heuristics. The key will be to train powerful ML techniques on sufficient amounts of high-quality, relevant data. To achieve this goal, we are building a diverse team that spans multiple disciplines within the life science and machine learning. We bring together cutting edge methods in functional genomics and lab automation to build a bio-data factory that can produce relevant biological data at scale, allowing us to create large, high-quality datasets that enable the development of novel ML models. We're hiring!
positions/1/description: Engageli has created an inclusive digital learning platform for superior teaching and learning experiences. The surge in online education that began in March of 2020 has highlighted the need for a purpose-built platform that is designed to optimize student success, which is exactly what Engageli has set out to build. We are excited to create a new learning experience that will enable both students and instructors to learn effectively in a digital format, which we hope will be as good or in some ways even better than an in-class experience.
positions/3/description: Calico allowed me to return to my passion of applying machine learning to improve human health. As Calico’s first Chief Computing Officer, I built an amazing team working on new computational methods for analyzing biological data sets to help better understand the process of aging and developing interventions that enable people to live longer, healthier lives.
summary: For most of my career, I've been working at the boundary of two disciplines: machine learning and biomedicine. But until recently, machine learning has not had the same impact on biomedicine as it's had on so many other challenging domains. The reason for that is twofold: not enough high-quality, relevant data; and not enough "bilingual" people who understand both domains and are able to identify the important problems and design the "right" solutions. At insitro, we aim to address both these challenges, and help address an important societal problem: design novel, safe, and effective therapies that help more people, faster, and at a lower cost. We have many exciting and challenging problems, and are building a diverse team of exceptionally talented people. Please join us!

occupation: Head of Business AI at Meta | Founder of Hearsay | TIME 100 AI
positions/0/description:
Lead Meta's new Business AI group. This organization is focused on building products that make cutting-edge AI accessible to every business, from zero to one to scale.

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Today, 200M businesses each month turn to Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp to connect with billions of consumers around the world. Meta’s Llama models have over 600M downloads to date, and Meta AI has more than 500M monthly actives. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology.
positions/1/description: Early stage investor and advisor to startups including Perplexity, Lakera, Bardeen, Qodo (Codium), Color, Ethos Life, and Gusto
positions/3/description:
Led AI efforts across Salesforce, including product, applied research (frontier team), domain-specific model development, go-to-market, revenue, adoption, partnerships, acquisitions, and responsible AI. The four years I spent as a boomerang at Salesforce have been some of the most rewarding in my career.  The organization we built, execution speed, and customer and revenue impact of the generative AI platform we developed from prototype to GA product were unmatched. 

It all started in 2022 with 'Gucci GPT'-- an LLM application prototype we developed with Salesforce Research when I was leading Service Cloud, to suggest accurate, on-brand responses to customer service inquiries. We moved at startup speed and rapidly built a prototype that cut support resolution times while increasing NPS and commerce revenue. When ChatGPT captured the world's imagination that November, we were ready with our learnings and shipped 'Einstein GPT for Service and Sales' just a few months later. I was asked to take on a new role to build out an AI platform and organization to support sales, marketing, commerce, and 3p developer use cases beyond Service Cloud. 

Our team built the Einstein AI Trust Layer (prompt injection defense, toxicity filters, observability and monitoring), Prompt Builder, Model Builder (to support 3p models including Llama and OpenAI, and finetuning), Advanced RAG, and Agentforce Studio, shipping at incredible speed to get to product-market fit. We had to invent new methods to upskill our 11,000 salespeople and broader ecosystem. We started an applied research incubation team in partnership with Salesforce Research, called Frontier/Atlas, for rapid experimentation that has delivered Generative Canvas UX, LLM Benchmarks for CRM, and Atlas reasoning engine, to ensure an ongoing cadence of organic innovation. The company went through a difficult period in 2022, and these efforts helped re-energize the entire organization and ecosystem.
positions/4/description: Starting and scaling a company from 'zero to one' was one of the best, hardest experiences I've ever had. It's been a privilege to serve for 11 years as Hearsay's CEO. In 2020, I transitioned to Board Chair, and in 2024, Hearsay was acquired by Yext, Inc. (NASDAQ:YEXT).
summary:
Head of Business AI at Meta, founder of Hearsay Social (now part of NASDAQ:YEXT), angel investor, author of The Facebook Era (2009) and Social Business Imperative (2016), kindergarten room mom. Former CEO of Salesforce AI.

Interests: AI, future of work, board governance, UX, and coffee.

summary:
😱🙄😲 WAAAAS? Wieso darf der sich Mr. Transformation nennen? 
Eine berechtigte Frage und vielleicht hattest du im ersten Augenblick sogar ein Störgefühl. 

Ich könnte jetzt hier eine ganze Tapete schreiben, warum ich mich dort sehe. Hier kommt eine gute Idee: Stell mir deine wichtigste oder schwierigste Frage zu Transformation. Egal ob deine persönliche, die eines Teams oder gar eine ganze Organisation.

😎☀️👍🏼 Du investierst also 1 Minute und bekommst eine wirklich hilfreiche Antwort - versprochen.


Nun zu Transformation...

3 Faktoren zählen...
... TransformationsBEREITSCHAFT
... TransformationsFÄHIGKEIT
... TransformatinonsGESCHWINDIGKEIT

Das nachhaltig aufzubauen ist meine Kernkompetenz!

➡️ 3 Kernfragen
❓Was ermöglicht persönliche Veränderung?
❓Wie wird Transformation für Unternehmen ein Wettbewerbsvorteil?
❓Wie verlassen wir Ohnmacht, Frust und Stress hinzu Schöpferkraft mit Sinn und Leichtigkeit?

➡️ Alle Ergebnisse sind menschengemacht und somit immer eine Folge des Denkens. Das Denken ist eine Folge der inneren Haltung. Und daraus entstehen Handlung und Resultate.

✅ Somit gilt: Wer andere Ergebnisse möchte, braucht eine andere Haltung. 

🚀 Leicht gesagt, oder? Ich zeige machbare Wege für Menschen und Organisationen auf.

Bei mir findest du zahlreiche Antworten dazu. Keine blaue Pille (Matrix), dafür viele praxiserprobte Ansätze, die auch du für dich, dein Team oder dein Unternehmen einsetzen kannst.

Explore and enjoy!

I am a trained physician and journalist with experience in medical science, patient care and editorial work. Currently I am serving as an executive editor with Germany's leading health-focused publishing company.

Today I am focusing on delivering the best reliable, comprehensible, useful health and medical information for lay and professional audiences via all media channels (digital, print) and media forms (video, audio, text, photo, charts).

I've had the chance to learn from top physicians and scientists during my training at University of Munich and Yale University, and to learn from the finest editors at the German School of Journalism and at different media outlets, e.g. German daily "Süddeutsche Zeitung", German public radio "Bayerischer Rundfunk" and German news magazine "Der Spiegel".

After my training I worked in the Department of Anaesthesiology at University of Munich's hospital and at SPIEGEL ONLINE, "Der Spiegel"'s digital news outlet, before moving on to "Wort & Bild Verlag", where I am currently the Executive Editor.

I am always happy to connect with people, especially those interested in the same topics as me. Please feel free to contact me.

summary: Davide Scaramuzza is a Professor of Robotics and Perception at the University of Zurich. He did his Ph.D. at ETH Zurich, a postdoc at the University of Pennsylvania, and was a visiting professor at Stanford University. His research focuses on autonomous, agile navigation of mini drones using standard and event-based cameras. He pioneered autonomous, vision-based navigation of drones, which inspired the navigation algorithm of the NASA Mars helicopter and many drone companies. In 2022, his team demonstrated that an AI-powered drone could outperform the world champion of drone racing, a result published in Nature. He has been consulting the United Nations on disaster response, the Fukushima Action Plan, disarmament, and AI for good. For his research contributions, he has won many awards, including the very recent IEEE Kiyo Tomiyasu Technical Field Award, the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society Early Career Award, a European Research Council Consolidator Grant, and many paper awards, including the IROS 2023 Best Paper Award, the IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters' and Transactions on Robotics best paper awards, and a 2023 CVPR Best Paper Award finalist. Davide contributed significantly to visual-inertial state estimation, vision-based agile navigation of microdrones, and low-latency, robust perception with event cameras. His results have been transferred to many products, from drones to automobiles, cameras, AR/VR headsets, and mobile devices. Davide counts several entrepreneurial achievements: in 2015, he co-founded Zurich-Eye, which became Meta Zurich, which developed the world-leading virtual-reality headset Meta Quest. In 2020, he co-founded SUIND, which builds autonomous drones for precision agriculture. Many aspects of his research have been featured in the media, such as The New York Times, The Economist, and Forbes.

summary:
I am a seasoned professional with a passion for developing consultative partnerships and guiding clients through their business transformation journeys.  I have an unwavering commitment to delivering high-value technology solutions that drive innovation and success. I also have expertise in helping organizations leveraging Salesforce solutions to unlock their full potential.

Throughout my career, I have embraced my role as an agent of change, consistently driving innovation as a business analyst, solution architect, project manager, engagement manager, and sales executive. I thrive on understanding my clients' unique challenges and leveraging my expertise to identify and deliver technology solutions that expand capabilities, optimize operations, enhance competitive advantage, and deliver unparalleled customer experiences.

I am driven to deliver high quality solutions and a superior customer experience. I understand that success lies in fostering differentiated and frictionless relationships with customers, employees, partners, and stakeholders. By considering your business needs, priorities, and transformation goals, I ensure that my solutions align with your strategic objectives while delivering an exceptional customer experience.

I have a deep understanding of Salesforce and the broader Salesforce ecosystem.  I have expertise in integrating Salesforce seamlessly with other systems to create tailored, best-of-breed solutions. My background in project lifecycle management and solution architecture allows me to navigate technical complexities and define projects that adhere to best practices and effectively utilize agile methodologies while mitigating risks.

I believe in forging deep, high-touch relationships with customers to drive strategy and innovation and to differentiate your organization from the competition. Whether you are considering the next steps in customer service, customer experience, or embarking on a digital transformation journey, I am eager to collaborate with you. Reach out to me to discuss your business needs, priorities, and transformation goals. headline: Foreign Affairs Officer at U.S. Department of State
occupation: Foreign Affairs Officer at U.S. Department of State
positions/0/description: Supports the Global Defense Reform Program (GDRP) in the Department of State's Bureau of Political-Military Affairs, Office of Global Programs and Initiatives (PM/GPI).  Primarily focused on supporting contracts, grants, and inter-agency agreements for programming in countries in the EUCOM AOR.  GDRP provides advisory support to enhance security sector governance and institutional capacity, partnering with countries to develop national security strategies and national defense strategies, to improve defense and resource management, and to build capacity in areas such as cybersecurity.
positions/2/description: Advised senior Department of State officials and facilitated inter-agency coordination on UN peacekeeping policy, peacekeeping mandates, and peacekeeping performance.  Provided analysis and guidance to the U.S. Mission to the United Nations on peacekeeping-related UN resolutions and mandates, and high-level peacekeeping visits and events.  Consulted broadly and maintained liaison with multilateral and non-governmental organizations, partner nations, and U.S. Congress on peacekeeping policy and performance issues.  Served as lead for the transition of the African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) to the AU Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS) and for the transition and drawdown of the UN-AU Hybrid Operation in Darfur (UNAMID).  Coordinated U.S. participation in biannual UN Peacekeeping Ministerial meetings.  Deployed to Doha, Qatar in August 2021 to support the evacuation of U.S.-affiliated personnel from Afghanistan, serving as a core member of Operation Allies Welcome, coordinating onward flights to regional hubs and the United States with various charter airlines and U.S. military partners.  Completed developmental assignment as the Deputy Director to the U.S. Africa Command (AFRICOM) Liaison Office in Washington, DC, Joint Staff, U.S. Department of Defense.
positions/3/description:
Office of Security Affairs; Bureau of African Affairs

As the Central Africa Regional Security Affairs officer in AF/SA (formerly the Office of Regional Security Affairs), advised senior leaders on security affairs policy issues and managed multi-dimensional Security Sector Reform (SSR) programs in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), the Central African Republic (CAR), Republic of Congo, Burundi, Rwanda, Chad, Cameroon,  Gabon, and South Sudan.  Served as Contracting Officer's Representative, planning procurements and managing contracts that trained, equipped, advised, and assisted the militaries in DRC and CAR to become more professional, capable, and accountable defense institutions.  Liaised and coordinated with interagency stakeholders regarding U.S. support to peacekeeping operations and troop/police contributing countries, including looking for ways to enhance peacekeeper performance and improve accountability for human rights abuses in peacekeeping missions.  Regularly drafted briefing papers, presentations, and memos for front office leadership on emerging security issues and related U.S. policies and programs.  Represented AF/SA at executive-level NSC meetings, military planning meetings and exercises, and interagency strategic planning meetings.
positions/4/description:
Program Officer, Office of Anti-Crime Programs; Bureau of International Narcotic and Law Enforcement Affairs

As a program officer for the Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs, Office of Anti-Crime Programs, supported the International Law Enforcement Academy (ILEA) Gaborone and Regional Training Center (RTC) in Accra, Ghana in providing law enforcement and criminal justice sector training to regional member states.  Served as Contracting Officer's Representative, monitoring performance of a $3.5 million contract for RTC operations and course deliveries, coordinating programming at the RTC with contractor, intra-agency and Embassy Accra stakeholders, and interagency law enforcement training divisions.  Also served as Agreements Officer's Representative, overseeing implementation of INL/C's Interagency Agreements with four federal law enforcement agencies to ensure accountability and compliance with reporting requirements.  Analyzed budgets for both facilities, worked with program management staff to build annual training schedules, liaised with embassy staff to coordinate participant attendance at trainings, and worked with ILEA team to develop policy responses to emerging issues.
summary: Program planner and manager; peacekeeping expert; African affairs expert; security sector reform, post-conflict peacebuilding, and security cooperation professional.  Passionate, dedicated public servant for 15+ years.  Problem solver, skilled negotiator, proven communicator.

positions/3/description:
The Edinburgh Data-Intensive Research group sits in the School of Informatics of the University of Edinburgh and is part of the UK's National e-Science Centre and the school's Centre for Intelligent Systems and their Applications. We collaborate closely with the National e-Science Hub of the University of Glasgow and EPCC of the University of Edinburgh.

Data-intensive refers to huge volumes of data, complex patterns of data integration and analysis and intricate interactions between combinations of users and systems that deal with these data. Our mission is to advance methods that harness the power of data and computation in collaborative environments. Our goal is to support the life cycle of data to information to knowledge in a multi-disciplinary and multi-organisational context. To achieve this we pursue research in e-Science and Informatics and apply our methods in several scientific and industrial domains.

summary:
I advise investors and start-ups from the venture capital ecosystem on IP/IT law with a particular focus on innovative technologies. In particular drafting of software licenses, cooperation and R&D agreements, especially with respect to artificial intelligence, machine learning and deep learning technologies. Basically all issues surrounding intellectual property and information technology law concerning the development, training, protecting and distribution of AI software services (AI-as-a-Service), including regulatory questions on compliance and data privacy. Also, all sorts of SaaS platforms in general, including licensing and terms of use in B2B and B2C context.

Another focus of my activities is advising providers from the crypto- and web3-space, such as wallet and blockchain providers, routing aggregators, web3-gaming platforms or digital agencies, artists and publishers on the development and implementation of NFT projects.

I aim to use research and technology development to trigger innovations in the industry and the public sector, addressing major societal challenges. In this context, it is my responsibility to shape the strategic and economic development of the Fraunhofer-Society in line with current innovation policy and to establish new, approaches for collaborative innovation at Fraunhofer.

positions/4/companyName: Transferwissenschaft (technology transfer as a research field)
positions/4/description: As head of the Transferwissenschaft Alliance, my goal is to achieve excellence in knowledge and technology transfer. To this end, I analyze technology transfer between science, business, politics, and society in the German innovation system together with my teams at Fraunhofer and TU Berlin. Together, we design transfer strategies and develop novel innovation methods and processes for high-impact research and a strong innovation system. Based on the results of our projects, I provide strategic advice to research organizations, companies, and policymakers.
summary: Shaping the future of technology is what drives me. I'm excited about the potential of AI technologies to have a major impact on the economy, society, and the environment. Working together with partners from research, industry, start-ups, politics, and society, I want to bring artificial intelligence into application. As an expert for technology transfer and innovation ecosystems, I have developed and successfully implemented strategies and methods for the Fraunhofer-Society, which is Europe's largest RTO, over the past 10 years. I have provided scientifically sound consulting services to companies, research institutions, and politics in numerous projects. I draw on a broad set of methods from design research, social and economic sciences for innovation, dialogue, and transformation processes.

summary:
As a Senior Consultant at Audi AG, I have been supporting the company for over 19 years in navigating complex and dynamic changes in the automotive industry. With my Ph.D. in Sociology and my expertise in change management and organizational development, I enable the company to balance exploration and exploitation, and to foster a culture of learning and renewal.

I am also a Senior Partner at GfeO mbH, a spin-off company from the University of Regensburg, where I provide change consulting services to various clients across different sectors and regions. I leverage my academic background and credentials in sociology, psychology, and economics to design and implement effective and sustainable solutions that address the challenges and opportunities of the digital transformation. Additionally, I am a lecturer at several prestigious universities and a member of the editorial board of a journal on applied organizational psychology. I am passionate about sharing my knowledge and insights on change communication, organization theory, and high-performance teams with the next generation of leaders and practitioners.

headline: Professor at University of Tennessee
honors/0/description: Fellow, American Institute of Architects 2013
occupation: Professor at University of Tennessee
summary:
Ted Shelton is an architect whose work and research are focused on the integration of design and technology with an emphasis on green architecture.  He holds NCARB certification and is a LEED Accredited Professional.  Along with Tricia Stuth, he is a partner and co-founder of the firm curb, which is devoted to creating architecture that is well-designed, sustainable, and intimately tied to its place. They were winners of both the Plan Section Sentence Competition and the HOME House Competition and semifinalists in the Kielder Observatory Competition sponsored by the Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA). Their work has been recognized with merit awards from AIA East Tennessee, AIA Tennessee, and AIA Gulf States Region and been published in ARCADE: Journal of Northwest Architecture and Design, the Journal of Architectural Education, and HOME House: the Future of Affordable Housing.

Prof. Shelton is also a partner in Applied Research - a collaborative design team of University of Tennessee faculty members from the College of Architecture and Design. Combining the research interests of four faculty members, the group advances an architectural discourse by focusing on several key areas that include green design, material and construction technology, adaptive reuse, urban and community development, and spatial poetics. Applied Research was a finalist in the Jefferson Heights Tomorrow Sustainable Housing Competition for the design of environmentally progressive infill housing in Chattanooga, TN.

Specialties: design, technology, and sustainability

occupation: Applied Learning Scientist
positions/1/description: Helping organizations develop innovative cognitive assessments, educational games, evidence-based coursework, and engaging digital media for learners of all ages. Services include learning experience design, curriculum design, efficacy research, learning analytics, adaptive system infrastructure design, assessment validation.
positions/3/companyName: Squirrel AI Learning by Yixue Group
summary:
I am a learning scientist on a mission to craft the next generation of learning experiences. 

Over the past 17 years, I have worked on the design, evaluation, and improvement of a number of adaptive learning systems for learners, from 3-year-olds to professionals, for learning math, science, reading, medical science, and more.

I have also worked on assessments of 21st century competencies, curriculum design for project-based learning with VR, and learning design for a college experiential learning program. 

I think great learning experiences come about when we put the learners first, engineer for evidence, and learn as we go. And we do it together in interdisciplinary teams. 

My work is often a blend of cognitive psychology, learning analytics, efficacy research, psychometrics, and partnerships (I can't do it all myself!). You can find me translating research to learning product design and strategy, leading efficacy studies, pulling insights from learning analytics to inform product design and improvements, creating and validating assessments, establishing and maintaining partnerships with various organizations and consultants. I enjoy every aspect!

I also enjoy sharing what I've learned. Some of my recent publications:
- The Handbook of Research on Innovative Approaches to Early Childhood Development and School Readiness: https://www.igi-global.com/book/handbook-research-innovative-approaches-early/272193. 
- A couple chapters on human-centered design and data analytics in the Learning Engineering Toolkit: https://www.routledge.com/Learning-Engineering-Toolkit-Evidence-Based-Practices-from-the-Learning/Goodell-Kolodner/p/book/9781032232829
- A chapter on applying learning engineering to create math games for 2-3 year olds: https://link.springer.com/referenceworkentry/10.1007/978-3-319-17727-4_192-1

Further information: www.netzoekonom.de/Vortraege
positions/2/description: Lecturer at the Department of Business Informatics of Technical University Darmstadt. I teach master students in the subject "Digital Transformation". More information: https://www.netzoekonom.de/lehre-an-der-tu-darmstadt/
positions/3/description: Habe in der FAZ mehr als ein Jahrzehnt über die digitale Wirtschaft geschrieben, meist auf der Sonderseite Netzwirtschaft und als "Netzökonom" im gleichnamigen Blog. Zudem als "Internet-Koordinator" zwischen 2002 und 2011 für die Zusammenarbeit zwischen Print- und Online-Redaktion zuständig.
summary:
Dr. Holger Schmidt has been examining digitization from an economist's perspective for two decades. He teaches Digital Transformation at TU Darmstadt and gives lectures on topics such as digital economy, platform economy, and artificial intelligence. Since selling his newsletter on digital transformation and platform economy to the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, he also serves as the Editorial Director for Newsletters & Verticals and the responsible editor for the F.A.Z. PRO D:ECONOMY Briefing.
Personal Website: ▷ www.netzoekonom.de
F.A.Z. PRO D:ECONOMY ▷ www.faz.net/pro/d-economy

Appointed by SVP of Commercial Operations into this product focused role comprised of molecular diagnostics, flow cytometry and multiplexing products. Initially tasked to develop and launch new molecular diagnostic and multiplex platforms. Role pivoted to manage product development in response to COVID. Led multi-million-dollar marketing/product development budget, team of direct reports and staff.

Promoted to lead cross functional team in strengthening sales discipline, process and infrastructure to accelerate revenue growth. Reported to executive team on forecasts, revenue plans, QBRs. Created and tracked key business metrics to assess revenue risk, customer satisfaction, and account performance. Managed, developed, and elevated skills of team.

summary:
I have always been analytically and process oriented. Whether playing sports or music, I spent a lot of time in my youth perfecting my game or my performance by breaking down the game or musical piece into its parts, putting them back together, and coming up with ways to improve both. These traits were central throughout my life, first academically and then career-wise, as I earned my MBA and pursued a career in life sciences.

Today as a market savvy Global Commercial Leader I leverage that background along with deep subject matter and industry knowledge to drive revenue, market, and profit growth in biotech / life sciences / diagnostics space. A valued and agile member of executive teams, I have been appointed to mission critical multi-functional roles across global markets and product categories. I am noted for grasping new concepts quickly and applying them to address complex business challenges. 

By blending business savvy, strategic thinking, and natural ability to optimize individual and team performance with persistence, focus, and executive acumen to deliver results in key performance areas. 

Global Product Development and Launches - Expanded Luminex’s MAGPIX system.  Built global commercialization, product development and launch team to refine product prototypes and ensure operational readiness.

Functional and Cultural Agility – Appointed to EMEA marketing and scientific affairs leadership role, led international team, and launched NxTAG Respiratory and ARIES System products into EMEA.

Organizational Capability – Rebuilt EMEA marketing and scientific affairs including marketing communications and leadership; built training laboratory and acquired instrumentation to enhance sales / applications knowledge and competitiveness of molecular diagnostic platforms.

Acquisition Integration – Led EMEA integration of Nanosphere, optimized distribution network, onboarded employees, and built capability around new products; Led global sales carve-out integration of Merck’s Flow Cytometry business.

Team Leadership – Recruited and led highly engaged global, US-based and European teams in sales, marketing, applications, distribution management with high retention and loyalty including during periods of great industry and company change.

Additional Skills…

Marketing Planning and Execution | SF.com / CRM | Sales Forecasting | Sales Analytics | KPIs | Sales Compensation | Channel Management | Pricing | Product Training | Strategic Partnerships | User Experience | Product Development | Voice of the Customer | Scientific Affairs | Contract Development

summary:
With over 20 years of experience in various industries, Ralf Belusa is a visionary & influential leader who drives business & transformation across 144 countries. As the Managing Director at Hapag-Lloyd, he is responsible for the global digital business, product development, growth management, marketing, and organizational transformation of one of the world's largest container shipping companies. He has a successful track record of generating multi-billion business growth, implementing agile and cost-effective technology, and developing high-performance teams.

Ralf Belusa is also a Member of the Supervisory Board at PHOENIX Pharma Group, an integrated healthcare provider that operates in 29 countries. He actively acts on AI, Kaizen, Automation, Ecosystems and oversees and advises the Board on strategy, business, AI, digital, sustainability, and transformation, leveraging his expertise in health and space-tech. He is passionate about accelerating digitalization and reinvention for a sustainable, regenerative, and livable future, and has been recognized several times as one of most important digital managers in Europe by Wirtschaftswoche. He is a lifelong learner, 2x TEDx speaker, and co-founder and investor of several start-ups. He holds a doctorate in cell research and has completed further studies in micro- and nano-technology, astrophysics, and artificial intelligence.

Mindful, collaborative & passionate about accelerating digitalization & reinvention for a sustainable, regenerative and livable future.

positions/0/company/name: IU International University of Applied Sciences

positions/0/description: As a professor at IU, I teach mathematics to students of engineering and management.
positions/1/description:
I am currently responsible for solving MAPEGY's challenges in data analysis and visualization.

The data science division at MAPEGY retrieves information from various heterogeneous, mostly unstructured data sources, such as patents, scientific publications, internet news, dictionaries, company registers.

We use that information to create actionable knowledge for our customers, via a host of methods such as natural language processing, network analysis, Bayesian statistics and many more.
positions/2/description: I moonlight as an author of academic textbooks on data science and applied mathematics.
positions/3/description: I have a long-standing experience in academia and published numerous scientific works on topics in image processing, differential geometry, relativity theory and pedestrian dynamics.
positions/4/company/name: Interdisciplinary Center for Scientific Computing, Heidelberg University
positions/4/companyName: Interdisciplinary Center for Scientific Computing, Heidelberg University
positions/4/description: At IWR in Heidelberg, I entered the world of (multi-dimensional) image processing and data analysis.
summary:
I'm a versatile problem solver with broad interests and an open mind, always looking forward to tackling challenging questions in applied mathematics. My journey has taken me from being a researcher in mathematical physics to a lead data scientist, and more recently, I’ve added the role of professor of mathematics to my career.

At heart, I’m a scientist driven by curiosity. My current research and professional interests include:

- Mathematical statistics and geometric data analysis
- Visualizing networks and interpreting high-dimensional data
- Exploring applications of large language models (LLMs), with a focus on embeddings and semantic search
- Teaching and mentoring in mathematics and statistics

In the past, I’ve explored topics such as:

- Mathematical relativity and Lorentzian geometry
- Simulating pedestrian flows in complex environments
- Image processing

I love working on interdisciplinary problems, blending theory with practical approaches to push boundaries—whether in academia, industry, or anywhere in between.

MoveGB, a fitness marketplace with a subscription business model, aims to maximise the retention of its customers by presenting them with tailored personalised activity recommendations. 

As part of a team on Pivigo’s ‘Science 2 Data Science’ programme, I worked on a project to develop and deliver both an early stage recommendation system based on artificial neural networks and a refined recommender based on clustering.

We used SQL, Python and machine learning to understand customer-preferences and deliver customised activity recommendations to MoveGB’s customers, taking into account customer-features such as demography, geography, attendance history and type of membership plus MoveGB’s partners’ features such as geography and popularity of activities. Analysis included natural language processing, clustering analysis and decision trees algorithms.

positions/3/title: Founding Member / Member of the Board
summary:
1) I want to bring AI from research into practice, in order to solve the world's most pressing issues: therefore I co-founded Merantix, where we build and invest in AI companies in industries such as healthcare, biotech, climate, manufacturing & automotive. Reach out to me if you want to join our mission!

2) I want to build strong ecosystems for AI in Europe: therefore I co-founded the AI Campus, a not-for-profit organization that runs the AI Campus Berlin, a co-working space for 80+ companies working on AI applications and more than 600 members. We are now on a mission to bring the AI Campus to a global scale.

3) I’m a strong advocate of pushing AI in Europe: therefore I co-founded and co-lead the German AI association (KI Bundesverband e.V.) representing the majority of Germany’s AI startups, and work closely with the German government on their AI strategy and implementation.


What I did previously: 
* Studied computer science at Oxford, Princeton and ETH Zurich
* Obtained a PhD in computer vision and deep learning
* Published 15+ papers at top-tier conferences and journals like CVPR, ICCV, and IJCV
* Scaled a deep learning powered service that analyzes faces to 150 million users 
* Founded Europe’s largest hackathon HackZurich
* Spent some time at Google and BCG
* Became Robocup Junior world champion

headline: Dedicated to confronting the grand challenge of climate change.
occupation: Dedicated to confronting the grand challenge of climate change.
positions/1/description:
Responsible for the development and implementation of cost-effective and environmentally sensitive tactics for management of insect pests. My research and outreach impacts extended nationally and internationally.

Published first popular guide to beneficial insects with >5,000 copies distributed.
positions/2/companyName: Cornell Institute for Climate Smart Solutions
positions/2/description: I provided overall visionary leadership of the Cornell Institute for Climate Smart Solutions (CICSS). This included staffing, programing, and execution of CICSS’s mission, which was to build stakeholder capacity and work toward a future where agricultural, environmental, and social systems are resilient in the face of a rapidly changing climate. In this role I helped raise the profile of climate change and how CICSS and Cornell are positioned to respond to this challenge given the depth and breadth of the expertise among the faculty and programs. I helped to ensure that Cornell is recognized and rewarded for being the global leader in climate change and its impact on agriculture and the food system.
positions/3/description: The College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS) at Cornell University is one of the premier college’s of agriculture and related sciences in the world. The Associate Dean is an influential member of the College leadership team and contributes to strategic planning, helps determine the allocation of resources, and provides leadership on diverse college initiatives all in support of teaching, research and extension. The Cornell University Agricultural Experiment Station (CUAES), which was established in 1888, is one of a national system of federally designated Experiment Stations located in every state. As Director, i was responsible for the $5.2 million annual allocation of funds to CUAES of which ∼$4 million was used to support research conducted by faculty in the Colleges of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Human Ecology, and Veterinary Medicine. I also oversaw management of seven research and educational farms located across New York State, several thousand acres of forested properties, four acres of greenhouses, 150 environmentally controlled plant growth chambers and 50 personnel.
summary: I dedicate all of my time to confronting the grand challenge of climate change and help people understand and appreciate what is happening, and what they can do, through the foods we all love and need - we all eat so can readily relate.  I have published climate change articles in the popular press - The Hill, Medium, Bulletin of the Atomic Scientist, Fortune, and USA Today and I am the lead author of Our changing menu: Climate change and the foods we love and need (Cornell Press 2021). I've done a TEDx Talk – Climate change: It’s time to raise our voices and I teach Climate change leadership, an on-line eCornell course. My life experiences include growing up on a one-cow dairy farm, serving in the Marines during the Vietnam War, being a father and someone’s partner for 51 years, and many years in leadership roles at Cornell University. I received my academic degrees from the University Wisconsin, the University of Arizona, and the University of California, Davis. I now hold the title of Professor Emeritus and will tell the climate change story, until I no longer can.

summary:
Maike Scholz is a senior compliance expert with extensive experience in the areas of compliance governance, AI governance and digital ethics, corporate digital responsibility (CDR), corporate security and crisis management. She has been leading international, interdisciplinary projects on digital ethics in artificial intelligence, AI governance and compliance governance for decades. Her current focus is on digital ethics in the context of artificial intelligence and the development of AI governance models. She is also Squad Lead for the topic of “Digital Ethics” and responsible for Deutsche Telekom's Code of Business Conduct and was instrumental in the operational foundation of the German Institute for Compliance e.V. Maike Scholz holds a degree in business administration from Fulda University of Applied Sciences and has numerous certifications, including in emergency and crisis management, business continuity management, risk management and compliance management.
