positions/0/description:
•	Implemented Shift-left approach, including Manual and Automation processes, test planning, and CI\CD pipeline using GitLab CI
•	Developed Test Automation framework for UI testing from scratch using Java, Selenium WebDriver, JUnit, RestAssured, Jenkins, Sauce Labs (for cloud testing)
•	Setup Selenium Grid local distributed network
•	Team lead for QA team - planned testing effort, suggested technologies/tools, wrote automation test plans
•	Planned, tracked, and reported work progress on assigned tickets using Azure DevOps management platform. Wrote QA process documentation
•	Developed automated test cases for functional and regression testing of the application
•	Wrote documentation and trained other QA resources on installation, usage, maintenance, and developing scripts using OOP principles, Design Patterns etc
•	Maintained Postman collection and integrated API tests in the CI pipeline using Newman
•	Participated in chatbot development and testing for the Customer Support line using CRM and OpenAI
positions/1/description:
•	Tech lead for SDET team, an active member of Test Automation Counsel
•	Created and maintained UI and API C# based automation frameworks, active contributor on a story basis
•	Author and implementor of best practices, branching strategies, and QA improvements
•	Writing Master test plans for the project, including Load, Performance, ETL, Functional (both manual and automated), Integration (REST API) testing, Accessibility and Localization testing, executed them and report the status to the stakeholders
•	Top performer (9.2 out of 10 in Annual performance review)
•	Participated in manual testing of the application, including story-based testing, regression, smoke, sanity, UAT and all other activities
•	Mentor for QA team and go-to person
•	Launched high-quality project on-time and onboarded first clients
positions/2/description:
•	Scaled up SDET team from 1 to 8 (including developers on occasion) by introducing processes, workflow, branching strategies and documentation
•	Improved existing automation framework based on C#, Specflow, Nunit, Selenium Webdriver by implementing parallel execution on 2 levels, optimizations, Data integrity test (end-to-end data validation of 300 fields) using SFTP protocol, multi-language support with max code reuse, database connection for preconditions, multi environment support and parameterized builds in Jenkins
•	Testing integrations with external services: CSOD corporate, DAPPS (Census) – real and emulator, Dedup (SSN secured storage) and others
•	Implemented CI pipeline in Jenkins Blue Ocean to support two development teams with the following steps: running Smoke in Dev environment, promotion to QA using TeamCity REST API, checking versions in JIRA (using JIRA REST API), waiting for cache warm up using custom solution (SMB protocol), reporting to Slack channel and emails, running Smoke and then Regression in parallel on different browsers (IE, Chrome, Firefox)
•	Setup Selenium Grid network for test execution
•	Migrated existing infrastructure of the team (build servers, test runners) from static VMs to AWS and building scalable (on demand) solution for CI\CD
•	Performed Accessibility testing for Section 508 compliance using JAWS and NVDA
•	Implemented custom script (JavaScript and Regex) for Chrome FormFiller extension to support a team with navigation through the app workflows

Metrics:
- Smoke test execution time decreased from 1 hour to 4 minutes (15x faster), 
- Regression test execution time decreased from 6,5 hours to 30 minutes (13x faster). Long term goal – 10 minutes for Regression
- Increased test coverage from 180 to 380 test cases (personal)
- Increased test coverage with the team up to 1200 (89% total coverage)
positions/3/description:
•	Managed on-shore and off-shore teams of 12 automation engineers, and defined strategies and tactics. Wrote user stories for the team, and supported team members with consultations and trainings. Managed team assignments, capacity, and velocity of team members, participated in hiring and interviewing processes.
•	Performed code reviews for team members using FishEye & Crucible tool

As a manager, introduced a new workflow and:
o	Improved execution performance by 509%
o	Increased test coverage by 137% by adding iPad platform and order-related tests
o	Decreased maintenance team effort by 51%
o	Decreased failure rate and test flakiness by 64%

As an architect, improved existing Java-Selenium-TestNG-Maven-Jenkins framework:
o	Integrated BrowserMob Proxy for DNS resolution (for multi-environment testing) and User-Agent modifying (to separate automation and manual\client traffic)
o	Implemented auto-logging utility to reduce repetitive manual logging with the help of EventFiringDriver and Reflection API
o	Integrated SauceLabs cloud service support for mobile test automation
o	Integrated SeleniumGridExtras for capturing videos, reducing maintenance of the distributed network, and creating a self-maintainable and self-recoverable system
o	Added Jasypt encryption library support to improve security
o	Utilized lower-level APIs and protocols such as JavaScript API, Grid REST API, HTTP, TestLink XML-RPC API, and Database for faster preconditions\test state generation
o	Implemented browser cookie injection mechanism for quick automatic login, add to cart, remove from cart, remove wish list, and other scenarios 
o	Set up Automation Jenkins pipeline for cross-platform regression testing with automatic rerunning of failed tests based on user roles
o	Implemented a data-driven approach to perform data validation in a database
o	Implemented Session Manager module to reuse and share a limited number of credentials across all the threads for better performance
positions/4/description:
•	Managed on-shore and off-shore teams, planned testing efforts, suggested technologies/tools, wrote automation test plans
•	Developed behavior-driven Test Automation framework for UI testing from scratch using Java, Groovy, Selenium WebDriver, Maven, Jenkins, Sauce Labs (for cloud testing), Selenium Grid (for distributed network testing)
•	Integrated Depicted (dpxdt) tool for screenshot comparison (perceptual differences) of different builds\environments of the application
•	Integrated Sauce Labs cloud-distributed service for 17 supported platforms with automatic Sauce Connect secured tunnel opening (to provide access to internal environments)
•	Integrated BrowserMob Proxy Java server for Basic Authorization and traffic sniffing
•	Developed and maintained automation script for Smoke/Regression testing for all 4 supported breakpoints (screen widths)
•	Created Load/Performance test script in JMeter for the entire application and executed as a part of user acceptance test (UAT)

“VAPI” (Vehicle API) project (Back-end team)

•	Validated displayed data in the app vs API data, VAPI vs LSCS (prior API service) during migration from LSCS service, VAPI vs Data dump (in CSV, XLS, XML file formats)

•	Implemented social networking support for data validation using Facebook API, Google API, Twitter API, Java mail API etc

positions/0/description: The epidemiological parameters community consist of a global collaborative working group coordinated by WHO, which aims to develop a global repository of epidemiological parameters which will be publicly accessible by modellers, epidemiologists, subject matter experts and decision makers to inform mathematical models and public health response. This repository is the first stop for experts wishing to contribute to this project. https://github.com/WHO-Collaboratory/collaboratory-epiparameter-community
positions/1/description: Mapping the use of WHONET, an information system developed to support The World Health Organization's (WHO) goal of global surveillance of bacterial resistance to antimicrobial agents. WHONET is an effective computerized microbiology laboratory data management and analysis program that can provide guidance for empiric therapy of infections, alert clinicians of antimicrobial resistance trends, and guide drug-policy decisions and preventive measures. The program facilitates sharing of data amongst different hospitals by putting each laboratory data into a common code and file format, which can be merged for national or global collaboration of antimicrobial resistance surveillance. My work is supervised by Dr. John Stelling.
positions/2/description: Virus Watch & Vaccine Watch Study: Conducting Research about Long-Covid in adults
positions/3/description: Virus Watch Study, UCL Research Department of Epidemiology and Public Health
positions/4/description: Policy analysis about the implementation of WASH policies on a national and local level in Hyderabad, capital of Telangana state, India under the supervision of Dr. GVS Murthy, Director of the Indian Institute of Public Health Hyderabad and Professor at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine.
summary:
As a trained Computational Epidemiologist with a strong passion for quantitative techniques and data analysis, I thrive at the intersection of public health and data science. My experience around the globe has equipped me with the skills to interpret complex datasets, identify patterns, and derive insights that inform meaningful policy decisions and health initiatives.

Currently, I am expanding my expertise by training in data science, where I'm honing my skills in programming, python, advanced statistical methods, and machine learning. I am particularly drawn to how data-driven approaches can solve real-world problems and contribute to improved health outcomes.
I am eager to leverage my analytical background and new data science skills in a dynamic role where I can contribute to innovative projects and collaborate with diverse teams. I believe in the power of data to drive change and look forward to exploring opportunities within the data science field.

Let’s connect and explore how we can work together to unlock the potential of data! 

https://github.com/SophieWeberEpidemiologist

occupation: Professor at University of California, San Francisco
positions/1/description: http://www.tedmed.com/talks/show?id=529952
positions/1/title: Why We Can't Stop Eating Unhealthy Foods
summary:
Laura A. Schmidt, PhD, is a Professor of Health Policy in the School of Medicine at the University of California at San Francisco. She holds a joint appointment in the Philip R. Lee Institute for Health Policy Studies and the Department of Anthropology, History and Social Medicine. Dr. Schmidt is also Co-Director of the Community Engagement and Health Policy Program for UCSF’s Clinical and Translational Sciences Institute. She received her PhD training in sociology at UC Berkeley, completed doctoral coursework in public health and also holds a masters degree in clinical social work. 

Dr. Schmidt studies addictive substances and brings this perspective to food policy reforms that could stem the growing global crises of obesity and related metabolic disease.  She works directly with policymakers at all levels of government to develop evidence-informed food policies, and studies how industry engages in the political process and the production of scientific evidence.  Dr. Schmidt's  research program has been sponsored by the National Institutes of Health, US Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, the World Health Organization and European Commission, as well as private philanthropies, including the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation (RWJF), Commonwealth Fund, Atlantic Philanthropies and the Laura and John Arnold Foundation.

honors/0/description:
The PECASE is the highest honor bestowed by the United States Government to outstanding scientists and engineers who are beginning their independent research careers and who show exceptional promise for leadership in science and technology. 

Established in 1996, the PECASE acknowledges the contributions scientists and engineers have made to  the advancement of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) education and to community service as demonstrated by scientific leadership, public education, and community outreach. The White House Office of Science and Technology Policy coordinates the PECASE with participating departments and agencies.

headline: Professor of Finance | Chairman, Executive Education | Keynote speaker
occupation: Professor of Finance | Chairman, Executive Education | Keynote speaker
positions/2/title: Vice Dean for Continuing Education and Alumni
positions/3/company/name: CEPR - Centre for Economic Policy Research
summary: Alexander Wagner balances two passions: the thrill of seeking knowledge about fundamentals of human behavior for knowledge's sake, and the desire to apply insights in the real world and to improve the workings of markets and organizations. As a professor at the Department of Finance of the University of Zurich (UZH) and as a Senior Chair of the Swiss Finance Institute (SFI), Wagner has taught corporate finance to thousands of eager students and hundreds of motivated executives, and he has helped shape governance systems of companies large and small. He is the Chairman of the Executive Education of the UZH Faculty of Business, Economics, and Informatics, and he is Co-Head of the UZH Center for Crisis Competence. He has served as chairman of a proxy advisor and as an independent counsel for PwC. His research focuses on corporate finance, sustainable finance, and behavioral economics. He obtained his PhD in Political Economy from Harvard University. In his hometown Linz, Austria, he completed studies in economics and law.

occupation: Retired chaplain, editor and pastor
positions/0/description: Writing, occasional speaking, caring for my wife and cats
positions/1/description:
I've been a volunteer for The Hope of Survivors since 2007, and now in retirement from chaplaincy will devote my ministry to leading that organization (beginning January 2022). 
THOS is a nonprofit, non-denominational ministry counteracting sexual misconduct by spiritual leaders. We help restore victims after the devastating scourge of clergy sexual misconduct and help spiritual leaders safeguard integrity.
positions/4/companyName: The Hope of Survivors (for victims of clergy sexual abuse)
positions/4/description: Conduct seminars for pastors on relational boundaries, Assist with Hope and Healing weekends for victims and their spouses, help victims reorient their lives with personal consultation, victim advocacy.
summary:
Personal Mission Statement: Collaborating in the Spirit to facilitate wellbeing for those who are victims of clergy sexual misconduct while fostering clergy integrity.

I want to leverage four decades of leadership, mentoring, media communication & caregiving to promote healing from emotional & spiritual dysfunction, which comes through discovering one's true identity in Jesus. I pursue through "high tech & high touch," facilitating connectivity through in-person dialog, social media tools, blogs & digital books for the online community, marketplace & classroom. 

   As a chaplain I served 10 law enforcement agencies in California, ministering to people in crisis & distress. As a pastor I made it a top priority to mentor leaders, young & old. Our team of elders transitioned into becoming the assistant executives of the church, overseeing all outreach & nurture activities. Forty-three ministries flourished. My strategy was to empower the elders while establishing with them an accountability system including mentoring & discipling.

   My leadership philosophy is rooted in mutual respect & trust. I help each individual identify their ministry passion & unique giftedness to become activated in the Spirit as a team. In counsel with the head of our organization, I gather the ministry group for strategic planning, generating goals that are both measurable & attainable. Then we develop action plans that are assigned with accountability & mentoring. The team is totally energized to fulfill a shared vision & implement the mission, transcending minimum job requirements.

  I monitor the progress of my staff and their outcome--but do not micromanage their process. I accept my own responsibility for the progress of my department, accountable ultimately to the head of our organization.

Specialties: Leadership by facilitating collaboration, writing, speaking, conflict resolution. Have written (or "ghost" written) 20 books, most recently "God Was There: true stories of a police chaplain."

summary:
Dr. Till Klein is the Head of AI Regulation at the non-profit appliedAI Institute for Europe gGmbH, following the goal to accelerate Trustworthy AI at scale. At appliedAI, and in his engagements as Expert with OECD.AI and GPAI, he is driving the co-creation of training, methods and tools for operationalizing emerging AI regulations, standards, and principles, from Europe and beyond.

Till gained several years of industry experience in Regulatory Affairs for Medical Devices, as Lead Auditor for Quality Management Systems, and as Head for Quality Management in a Drone Company, which equips him with practical skills and perspectives that are instrumental for applying Trustworthy AI.

He holds a Ph.D. in Business from the Centre for Transformative Innovation at the Swinburne University of Technology in Melbourne, Australia, and an undergraduate degree in Industrial Engineering. Besides AI, his research interests include Economic Geography, Social Networks, and Innovation Management.

positions/0/description: As Head of Partnerships at appliedAI, I lead a team of AI Transformation Strategists and Ecosystem experts responsible for the product ownership of all appliedAI Partnership Programs to support AI transformation of our partners and for nurturing and growing the appliedAI Ecosystem. These programs are designed to empower both larger companies and SMEs in accelerating their AI maturity, enabling them to effectively unlock value from AI. These comprehensive programs span over longer periods of time, offering 80-100 diverse formats throughout the year. They encompass a wide range of activities, including trainings, working groups, round tables, conferences, as well as personalized expert support (AI consulting) and one-on-one strategy sparring sessions. appliedAI Partnership Programs have been the beating heart of appliedAI's success since 2017. They bring together companies of all sizes and from diverse industries helping them navigate the complexities of AI adoption. Our partners include companies across various industries, such as SAP, BMW Group, Miele, EnBw, Linde, MunichRe, etc.

headline: Chair & Founder @ WestStar | National Talk Host
occupation: Chair & Founder @ WestStar | National Talk Host
positions/0/description:
--​> We are hiring qualified motivated professionals. http://www.komando.com/careers

I host the nation's largest weekend radio show that happens to be about living in today's digital world. The focus of my show is not political. I only speak of consumer electronics, what's happening or trending on the Internet, smartphones, online security, and more that makes up our digital lifestyle.

Other quick fun facts about the show: 

• Aside from the 400 stations here in the USA, the Kim Komando show is also broadcast internationally on the American Forces Radio Network. This consists of 177 different countries and every ship at sea.

• The Kim Komando Show web site (http://www.komando.com) receives 16 million page views and 3.9 million uniques per month.

• We deliver more than 12 million opt-in email newsletters each week.

• Advertisers include Carbonite, GoDaddy, SimpliSafe and more.

Every week, my team produces 150 pieces of exclusive web content that drives traffic, daily radio content, a weekly HD television show that is a reality peek into the national radio show, and two separate weekly columns carried by USA Today and FoxNews.

BUT I only allow top brands in front of my audience. We have grown some of the biggest audio players with the use of technology and analytics plus creative. We’re now in our 20th year. It works!
positions/1/description: I write two weekly columns for FoxNews.com
positions/2/description: I write two weekly columns for USA Today and Gannett News Wire.
positions/3/description: Bloomberg TV Show Host
positions/4/description: Many moons ago...
summary:
With over 28 years of experience in radio, television, and online media, I am a trusted voice and a recognized authority in the field of digital lifestyle. As the chair, founder, and national talk host at WestStar Multimedia Entertainment, Inc., I lead a team of talented professionals who produce and deliver quality content, products, and services to millions of consumers and businesses across the globe.

My mission is to inform, educate, and entertain my audience on the latest trends, innovations, and challenges in the world of consumer electronics, internet, smartphones, online security, and more. I also write weekly columns for FoxNews.com and USA Today, sharing my insights and opinions on various tech topics. I am honored to be a 2021 Radio Hall of Fame Inductee and a keynote speaker at the National Association of Broadcasters. I am passionate about using technology and analytics to grow and engage my audience, as well as partnering with top brands that share my vision and values.

positions/2/title: Research Assistant in Operating Systems Group
summary:
2009 - Martin is department head at Fraunhofer IESE. 
He is heading the Embedded Systems Engineering department. 
Core competencies of the department include: 
- Model-based Systems Engineering, esp. RE and System Architecting/Design.
- Variation Management =  Variant & LifeCycle Management 

His specialties: 
• Software and Systems Product Line Engineering, esp. architectures and implementation
• CPS-Architectures with focus on self-adaptivity, runtime adaptation and context-awareness
• Model-Based Systems Engineering

More on his C.V.:
Martin received his diploma in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering in 1997 from the University of Kaiserslautern. Between 1998 and 2003, he worked in a special research project on large system development with generic methods (SFB 501), where he developed several approaches for architecting and managing software product families.

In 2004, he received his Ph.D. (Dr. Ing.) in Computer Science in the field of variability management from the University of Kaiserslautern and got affiliated with the Product Line Architecture department of the Fraunhofer Institute for Empirical Software Engineering (IESE) in Kaiserslautern.  As a project manager, he conducted several applied research and technology transfer projects in the area of software product lines, component-based development, configuration support, and adaptive systems. From 2006-2009 he has coordiniated Fraunhofer IESE’s competence center on Ambient Intelligence (AMI) and Ambient Assisted Living (AAL). His special interest in AMI/AAL were reference architectures with focus on interoperability, adaptability and trustworthiness and context management.

Faculty in the Finance Program in the Administrative Sciences Department at Metropolitan College.

Research interests include systemic risk, complex networks in banking and finance, corporate finance with a focus on firms' capital structure, and machine learning.

Teaching Quantitative Methods for Finance, Derivative Securities & Markets, Investment Analysis & Portfolio Management, Case Studies in Corporate Finance, and Interdisciplinary Methods in Quantitative Finance (Python & ML for Finance)
positions/2/description:

PY 105/106:  Elementary Physics 
PY 313:  Modern Physics for Engineers
PY 351:  Introduction Modern Physics for Physics Majors

Taught lab sections in 
PY 105/106:  Elementary Physics
positions/4/description:
Data-driven interdisciplinary research supervised by Prof. H. Eugene Stanley (physics) and Prof. Irena Vodenska (finance).

+ Built a python data pipeline to download and clean over 5 million foreign exchange rate quotes as well as macroeconomic data from various sources. Classified characteristic currency states and behaviors using clustering algorithms and identified central bank interventions. Paper selected for presentation at the 2017 FMA Applied Finance Conference and published in Quantitative Finance.
+ Modeled and simulated shock propagation in the European bank network, demonstrating the systemic risk due to portfolio overlap. Identified regime changes based on behavioral and liquidity parameters. Paper selected for presentation at the Second Conference on Network Models and Stress Testing for Financial Stability by Banco de México (2017) and accepted at the Journal of Financial Stability.
+ Identified community formation in global financial markets and lead-lag relationships. Results published in Risks.

positions/0/description:
My heart beats for Technology and Impact.

Axel Springer is an international media and technology company and operating in more than 40 countries. The portfolio currently consists of over 250 companies such as Business Insider, Politico, idealo and StepStone.

Achievements: 
- Built and led Global ESG Strategy for Data & AI, incl. strategic initiatives, while establishing it as guidance for Axel Springer 's diverse companies.
- Identified Strategic KPIs and led development of Axel Springer ESG Management Dashboard with Tableau and AWS for Executive Board.
- Created strategic presentations for the Executive and Supervisory Board and provided reportings for stakeholders.
- Contributed to AI Ethics guidelines and created briefings on regulatory and technical compliance topics such as Responsible AI and EU AI Act.
- Trained over 656 employees on Responsible AI, Data & AI Literacy within the Axel Springer group.
- Positioned Axel Springer as a thought leader by creating impactful content, delivering talks and hosting events, generating over 757,842 impressions from 34 company-related LinkedIn posts in one year.
- Selected for C-Level Potential Program by the Global Talent & Executive Development team, recognizing my leadership and strategic capabilities.

Entrepreneurship, Strategy & Business Development
• Developed and executed a Go-to-Market strategy that facilitated collaborations with prestigious companies including Meta, Yelp, AXA, Porsche, Intel, IBM, Samsung, BMW, and others. Managed the full sales cycle by qualifying opportunities, promoting services, capturing requirements, and successfully implementing projects for clients.
• Directed high-impact PR and marketing campaigns that secured features on Forbes, Business Insider, and other major news outlets. Cultivated influential relationships with key business and political stakeholders, leveraging executive-level communication skills.
• Translated business concepts into thought leadership on Diversity in Technology, Data Analytics, and AI. Recognized with multiple awards, including Forbes 30 Under 30 List.

Public Speaking, Thought Leadership & Event Management

• Organized community events for tech related topics

Campaigns, Advocacy & Developer Relations

summary:
As an award-winning Executive Leader, Author, LinkedIn Top Voice, Advisory Board Member and Founder with more than 8+ years of experience in the tech industry, I have been recognised by Manager Magazin as one of the most prominent voices in the field of Artificial Intelligence.

MY MISSION
Currently I am leading Data & AI Strategy for ESG at Axel Springer, Europe’s largest media and tech company. Furthermore, I founded Inclusive Tech, Europe's first initiative for Diversity in Tech and AI Ethics, which won several awards. I specialize in translating business needs into impactful strategies, processes and products. 

ACHIEVEMENTS I’M PROUD OF
▪ Thought Leader, LinkedIn Top Voice, Expert and Guest Lecturer on Responsible AI through
high-profile events (OMR, Forbes Women Summit), university lectures (HPI, TU Munich) & media visibility (ZDF, Spiegel).
▪ Expert in AI Ethics and Regulation: Enabling businesses to leverage responsible AI for growth while
ensuring compliance with EU AI Act and CSRD. Provided executive briefings and training.
▪ Recognized Industry Leader: Capital Top 40 under 40, and Forbes 30 Under 30 list maker.
▪ Strategic Partnerships: Built relations with global leaders (Intel, Adobe, Porsche). Represented brands at premier events, incl. WeAreDevelopers, Hannover Messe, and produced content for branding.
▪ Selected for Axel Springer C-Level Potential Program.
▪ Published author of the widely recognized book "FairTech: Rethinking Digitalization for a Just Society" at Bastei Lübbe influencing AI ethics discourse among public institutions, executives, universities.
▪ Founder of Inclusive Tech, an award-winning initiative for diversity in tech and AI Ethics. Recognized with Impact of Diversity Award by Accenture. Formed collaborations with industry (Yelp, Axa, Meta) and foundations (Koerber Foundation).
▪ Technical & Strategic Experience: Over 8 years in Data Strategy/Analytics in enterprise and start-ups. Developed Axel Springer ESG Management Dashboard, established function as first hire.
▪ Diversity Advocate: Founded inbetween, Axel Springer Employee Network for cultural diversity.

CONTACT: www.minasaidze.com | mail@minasaidze.com.

SUPER POWER: TECH + IMPACT
AI Governance, Responsible AI, Leadership, ESG Strategy, Data Analytics & Strategy, Executive Reporting, Stakeholder Management, Team Development, AI Compliance, B2B Marketing, LinkedIn Influencer

human is Germany’s first magazine for all who want to learn about artificial intelligence and benefit from the opportunities of AI developments for their working lives. It is a platform for fundamental orientation, lively knowledge transfer and practical utility value around humans and AI. 

The magazine was founded by Rebekka Reinhard, one of Germany’s most prominent voices in philosophy and literature. The Advisory Board consists of thought leaders from business and society including Alexander Doll (former Board Member Deutsche Bahn), Stephanie Schorp and Andreas Föller (Founder Comites).

Our Advisory Board is an informal, interdisciplinary body of people with a wide range of expertise from the "old" and "new" business world. This diversity of perspectives is very important to us. The Advisory Board Members provide ideas and impulses for topics and also appear as contributors in interviews or with their own essay in the first issue.

summary:
I am an experienced leader of clinical operations teams with many years in the Life Science industry in various settings ranging from large pharma, CRO and small biotech. After a couple of years as Head of the Nordic Site Management & Monitoring team I am now Global Head of Site partnerships and engagement at AstraZeneca.

My leadership is defined by trust, clear expectations and empowerment. I have built effective and organised teams where the individual grow to increased independence and contribution to the organisation. I have experience from change management, building a growing organisation, CRO contracting and oversight management and implementing strategies and processes. I’m experienced with all aspects of clinical trials from phase I to IV in various therapeutic areas from my work in the CRO business and the more recent clinical development consultancy.

I joined the pharmaceutical business in 2003 and held positions of increasing responsibility within the CRO business, before I joined Schering-Plough in 2005 as Medical Affairs Project Manager. 

From 2006 I managed the Clinical Quality and Compliance team at Schering-Plough Sweden where I collaborated with the regional team in Europe. 

From 2008 I was Manager Clinical Operations in Sweden where I participated in several global teams. I was a member of the local clinical operations leadership team. This was during integration between Schering-Plough and MSD.

From 2011 I was Manager Clinical Operations in Sweden at the Nordic CRO NORMA A/S. I was a member of the Nordic clinical operations leadership team as head of a constantly growing team of associates.

From May 2014 I was managing the Clinical Project Management team at the drug development company SDS. This was a combined role as Director and Senior Advisor Clinical Development in a fast growing company.

From October 2018 I am heading the Nordic Site Management & Monitoring organisation at AstraZeneca, responsible for delivery of AZs clinical trials in the Nordic region.

PhD thesis: "Leadership: Processes and Ambiguities"
Supervisors: Jörg Dietz and John Antonakis (both University of Lausanne)
Further committee members: Patrick Haack (University of Lausanne), Sim Sitkin (Duke University)
Teaching assistantship for OB and HRM courses in various programs (2014-2018)
Lecturer of the master's course "Evidence-based management" (2017-2018)
positions/4/title: PhD student, teaching assistant, and lecturer
summary:
I am an Associate Professor at the University of Geneva and the Yearly Review Editor of The Leadership Quarterly, the premier journal devoted leadership research. My research examines the conceptualization and measurement of leadership. I also study how people talk about their leadership and how they adapt their behavior to interpersonal and structural demands.

In my teaching, I am passionate about sharing HR knowledge from the perspective of individual managers to show how HR is an integral part of every manager's job (and leadership), not just a central function far removed from the core business. I also enjoy teaching leadership to professionals (e.g. EMBA students), focusing in particular on the changing leadership role expectations and how to deal with them.

Außerdem kommen viele weitere kaufmännische Aufgaben hinzu, sowie das Schreiben von Rechnungen, Prüfen und Freigeben von externen Rechnungen, Selektionen erstellen und auswerten etc. Der Umgang mit Word, Excel, Outlook sowie mit Programmen des Herstellers gehören damit zu meinem Alltag.
positions/3/description: Als Projektmanager war ich für die Erstellung einer Präsentbox an Kunden und Geschäftspartner zuständig. Ich konnte mich bei der Konzeptentwicklung und Teamkoordination einbringen. Die Kalkulation der Projektkosten, so wie die Auftragsvergabe lagen in meinem Zuständigkeitsbereich. Außerdem war ich der feste Ansprechpartner für die verschiedenen Dienstleister. Die Arbeit erfolgte hauptsächlich remote, sodass ich Erfahrung sammeln konnte mit den Diensten G-Suite, Asana, Slack und Miro.
summary:
Hi, mein Name ist Viktor und ich unterstütze dich gerne bei deinem Videoprojekt!

Von der Beratung, Ideenfindung, Konzeptionierung, Aufnahme, bis hin zur Postproduktion stehe ich dir gerne zur Seite.

📱 TikTok: Ergreife die Chance bei der am schnellst wachenden Social Media-Plattform dabei zu sein. Ich berate dich gerne dabei, wie wir deine Brand auf TikTok aufbauen.

📺 YouTube: Ich kann nicht nur 30 Sekunden Videos, ich kann auch Longform 😉 YouTube ist meine heimliche Liebe und ich unterstütze dich gerne bei deinem Projekt.

🎙️ Podcast: Dein Podcast gehört nicht nur auf die Ohren, sondern auch auf Social Media. Ich verwandele deine Podcast-Highlights in Snackable Content für TikTok, Instagram & Co.

Schreib mir gerne eine Nachricht für mehr Infos oder buche dir weiter oben direkt einen Termin.

headline: 👇 47 Page deck that will change your marketing
honors/0/description:
"It would be easy to think that Gary Vaynerchuk does nothing but talk: He broke into the new-media landscape with his Wine Library YouTube channel in 2006, now hosts the #AskGaryVee channel and makes constant public appearances when not being interviewed for articles.

But the Soviet Union-born, New Jersey-bred marketing guru can also point to results, starting with WineLibrary.com, the e-commerce site he launched for his parents’ wine shop in 1996, before he even owned a computer. “I understood people were going to buy wine on the Internet,” said Mr. Vaynerchuk, who eventually increased the store’s overall sales to more than $50 million from $3 million.

Meanwhile, VaynerMedia, the social-marketing agency he founded in 2009, and which counts Pepsi and General Electric among its clients, is set to top $50 million in revenue this year."

Read more here: http://www.crainsnewyork.com/40under40/Vaynerchuk
honors/1/description:
"Vaynerchuk has created two successful companies; he is a bestselling author; he can command six-figure fees for speaking engagements; and he has 1.1 million Twitter followers. But he is largely unknown to the American television-viewing public. Rather, he is Internet famous. That fame happened by design and by years of meticulous planning—and it has drawn vocal critics for a style that is loud, bombastic and blatantly self-promotional. (A sample exhortation from a video commanding people to subscribe to his YouTube channel: 'Fucking follow me, right now.')"

Read more here: http://fortune.com/2014/12/08/is-gary-vaynerchuk-vaynermedia-for-real/
honors/2/description:
"Mr. Vaynerchuk is not shy about embracing the title because he is not shy about anything. A small and kinetic man with dark hair that is starting to gray, he speaks with a warm, raspy voice, as though he’s been talking all day, which he usually has. He is funny and profane and gesticulates constantly, putting air quotes around phrases that he merely wants to emphasize. Among this favorite subjects are the New York Jets, which he has vowed to buy, and his own talents, which amaze even him.

“I have as big of an ego as it gets,” he said during a recent interview, in a tone suggesting that he was simply stating the facts, “but I have, stunningly, a lot of humility considering some of the accomplishments I’ve had.”

These accomplishments include the building of VaynerMedia, which opened in 2009 and now has 290 employees, serving clients as mainstream as Del Monte, General Electric and PepsiCo. They come in the hope that Mr. Vaynerchuk can do for them what he has already done for himself: build an online audience through pluck, ubiquity and charm."

Read more here: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/03/technology/riding-the-hashtag-in-social-media-marketing.html?_r=1

positions/0/title: Chairman of VaynerX, CEO of VaynerMedia
positions/1/description: VeeFriends is a contemporary entertainment company that combines art, storytelling, collecting, events and innovative technologies to build a community around a movement of kindness and positivity. The company’s mission is to scale 283 unique VeeFriends characters and their attributes to create a better world. These characters foster a sense of community and inspire creativity, self-discovery, accountability, and personal growth. VeeFriends’ characters represent qualities and traits Gary hopes to inspire in others. VeeFriends’ intellectual property was minted on the Ethereum blockchain to create unprecedented opportunities for utility, collectibility, and community building.
positions/2/description:
Vayner3 was founded to help the world’s leading enterprises navigate the next era of connected consumer behavior. Our mission is to grow your business by helping to build new markets and revolutionize digital engagement, charting a new course for enterprises. 

Vayner3 partners with leading brands to shape the next era of the internet; leverage AR, Blockchain, AI, and immersive digital experiences to future-proof your business.
positions/3/description: Liquid Death is natural mountain water served in ice-cold infinitely recyclable cans.
positions/4/description: VCR Group is a modern hospitality company comprised of kind and talented operators with a simple focus of creating consumer-centric experiences through unmatched hospitality.
summary:
Gary Vaynerchuk is a serial entrepreneur and serves as the Chairman of VaynerX, the CEO of VaynerMedia, and Creator and CEO of VeeFriends, and 6x New York Times Best Selling Author. Gary is considered one of the leading global minds on what's next in culture, business, and the internet. 

Known as "GaryVee," he is described as one of the most forward thinkers in business. He acutely recognizes trends and patterns early to help others understand how shifts in consumer attention impact the realities of the business world today. Gary's approach sits at the intersection of business and pop culture. He keenly understands how to bring brand relevance to the forefront. He is a prolific angel investor with early investments in companies like Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Venmo, Snapchat, Coinbase, and Uber.  

Gary is an entrepreneur at heart – he builds businesses. Today, he helps Fortune 1000 brands leverage consumer attention through his full-service advertising agency, VaynerMedia, which has ofﬁces in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Chicago, Delhi, Kuala Lumpur, London, Los Angeles, Mexico City, Miami, New York, Tokyo, Toronto, Singapore, and Sydney. VaynerMedia is part of the VaynerX holding company, which also includes Eva Nosidam Productions, Gallery Media Group, The Sasha Group, VaynerSpeakers, VaynerCommerce, and Tingley Lane Trading. Gary is the Co-Founder of VaynerSports, VCR Group, VaynerWatt, Resy, and Empathy Wines. He guided Resy and Empathy to successful exits -- which he later sold to American Express and Constellation Brands, respectively. He also owns a Major League Pickleball team called the 5s, is part owner of a Big3 basketball team, and is an investor in the revival of the SlamBall League. 

Gary is also the founder and creator of VeeCon – a contemporary super conference that converges business and pop culture with innovation and technology. In addition to running multiple businesses, Gary documents his daily life as a CEO through his social media channels, which have more than 50 million followers and garner more than 2+ billion impressions per year across all platforms. His podcast, "The GaryVee Audio Experience," ranks among the top podcasts globally.  

Gary serves on the board of MikMak, Bojangles Restaurants, Global Citizen Forum, Spin Master and Pencils of Promise. He is also a longtime Well Member of charity: water.

Gary's life ambition is to buy the New York Jets.

headline: Cardiac Electrophysiologist at Heart Rhythm Consultants of New York
occupation: Cardiac Electrophysiologist at Heart Rhythm Consultants of New York
positions/0/companyName: Heart Rhythm Consultants of New York
summary:
As a cardiac electrophysiologist (EP) my focus is on abnormal heart rhythms.  From pacemakers that help a weak heart beat stronger to surgeries that prevent palpitations, what I find most rewarding about my specialty is the long-term, life-altering, positive effects patients experience after undergoing an EP procedure.  Everything I do is designed to allow patients to live a normal life.  I often focus on the fact that each patient presents with a different set of symptoms and medical history and I understand that patients may initially be frightened by the prospect of undergoing an EP procedure.  But, I take great pride in the relationships I have established and always take the time to explain the complex workings of the heart and the intervention I feel would be most appropriate in straight-forward language, oftentimes even creating drawings to assist in communicating.  

My practice at St. Catherine’s of Siena Medical Center is unique in that it offers a small office feel with the level of care of a major medical center.  Through close relationships with every major hospital in the area, including St. Francis Hospital, I am able to offer my patients treatments that utilize the newest technology and advancements in the field of EP.  But this does not change the fact that when patients arrive at the office they are greeted by Barbara, and when they call for help on the weekend they get the only doctor ever on call: me.

I have also taken a sincere interest in the problem of physician alignment and how it can be improved with technology. This interest had led to the development of the DirectLineMD app which you can learn more about on my webpage (www.directlinemd.com) or by contacting me directly.

occupation: International Hispanist Communicator: University, CANVAS, AV Media, Publishing
positions/0/description:
In May 2015, PCC signed a new contract which prevents offering classes to pt instructors who had ever left PCC for a period exceeding two years, so that left me out. I had left for 3 years, first to go back to Pitzer College to teach Introd to Latin American Film (I had already done a gig at the Claremonts, with 2 courses on "Hispanic Civilization", which included History), and then to teach Introd Literature courses at CSU (Spain's, Latin America's, Modern Mexican, Contemporary Latin/Chicano). 

I found it exciting that these institutions would give me, a pt teacher, the courses that generally are assigned to full time faculty; but I got the better results, and not just per the student's evaluations, but by their performance at top universities, like USC. 75% of the teachers at US universities are part-timers and lack job stability, health insurance, etc.
In the USA, the Humanities/Social Sciences are being modified by means of CANVAS and other Learning Management Systems, as "A new college model" is being introduced by the Brookings Institution et al. (see L.A. Times, 11/16/15)
positions/1/description:
I've taught 3 years at the California State University System (CSU) —1995-96; 1998-99; 2013-14— at both CSULA & CSULB (the respective campuses in Los Angeles and Long Beach), in two of their departments: Modern Languages and Chicano Studies. 

Courses:Spanish I-II (Mod. '13) & Modern Mexican Literature in Translation (Chicano, Spring '14)

For the Chicano Studies course, I used MOODLE (an Open Source Learning Management course)
positions/1/title: Adjunct, Mod. Lang. Dep., (1995, 1998, 2013) & Chicano Studies Dep., Spring semester 2014
positions/2/description: 1st gig at the Claremonts was a 2 part course, "Introduction to Hispanic Civilization" (Pitzer & Scripps); 2nd gig was at Pitzer, teaching "Intro to Latin American Cinema", 2011
positions/3/description: I was editing the articles, doing the interviews, attending events, PR
summary: Consulting, editing, writing, helping people who need my skills as a thorough Hispanist —Spain and Hispanoamerica (Spanish speaking Latin America)—, that is and has been for years my goal as a part-time worker/consultant, with a long experience in university teaching, and several years in the Los Angeles media (print journalism, theatre, recently a tv appearance for Liberman's Estrella TV).
volunteerExperiences/1/description: in the Summer of '92, the Consulate of Spain, under Eduargo Garrigues, took the initiative to join forces with the Huntington Library, Gardens & Museums to organize an event commemorating the (controversial) arrival of Columbus (or Encounter or etc). The HL holds more than a hundred thousand Spanish/Hispanic documents dating from the 15th cent. I was the Docent assigned to the visiting group of 20 professors from the International Association of Hispanists (Molho was delighted to find Venetian paintings at the Museum). Another day, I led a group of kids from Watts through the 8 gardens, and we found a baby coyotte! It was the day of the riots; they were scared.

summary:
Hello there!

Currently I am responsible for developing project management applications and solution templates through our partner network on the cplace no and low code platform. In order to succeed within my role I developed a broad spectrum of diverse skills.

1. Selling ideas to partners: I am the person responsible for pitching and selling product ideas to our partner network. I conduct a thorough analysis before speaking to partners to have as much information as possible during the sales pitch and negotiations.
2. Stakeholder management: I collaborate with a wide stakeholdermap consisting of internal and external stakeholders. Therefore, I need to align strategies, manage expectations and search solutions to complex conflicts.
3. Market analysis: I am responsible for researching the market for certain applications and solutions. I workout a thourough documentation and pitch ideas to C-level management in order to provoke decisions which products to pursue with our partners
4. Software development: I consult and accompany the partner through the design sprints of products. The method is derived by the Google Venture approach "Sprint" by Jake Knapp.

I am proactive and search tasks and solutions independtly. My work style is highly conceptual and analytical and I bring structure to complex problems. I always appreciate input and feedback from managers and peers.

Reviewed exam forms for balance, relevance, and content
summary:
Geology Ph.D. graduate looking for an entry-level Instructor position. I have three years of Teaching Assistant experience and three years of Research Assistant experience. My teaching and research experiences have given me a specialty in Geochemistry, Mineralogy, and Petrology, while my course-work has provided me familiarity with Environmental and Economic Geology. 

As a Master's student, I modeled the formation conditions of plagioclase corona round garnets, a common metamorphic texture in orogenic regions. Through petrographic, SEM-BSE, and EMPA analysis, geothermobarometric calculations, and thermodynamic modeling, I determined that the plagioclase-corona-resorbed-garnet texture is the result of partial melting from regional uplift.

As a Ph.D. student, I used ICP-MS and ICP-OES analysis to chemically characterize the produced waters of the Tuscaloosa Marine Shale of Mississippi and Louisiana and published the results in Applied Geochemistry. Our findings concluded that dissolved solids in the produced waters are dominantly the result of hydrofracking fluids mixing with formation waters, most likely Louann Salt bitterns. We also determined that the concentration of some trace elements had loose correlations to the organic complexes of the hydrocarbon system (Cu and V). In contrast, others (Zn and Pb) may be more closely linked to metal availability and redox conditions of specific geologic units.

My dissertation (in progress) looks at the water-rock interactions during hydrofracturing in clay-rich (shale) host rocks and how variations in initial 'frack fluid' pH, salinity, and chemical composition affect these reactions. Experiments and analysis include batch reactions to determine mineral reaction rates through ICP-MS and ICP-OES analysis and observation of physical changes to porosity and permeability through photomicrographs and EDS elemental mapping. To date, we interpret the dominant reactions are carbonate dissolution and cation exchange between clays and organics with saline solutions. Secondary reactions are silicate dissolution and precipitation, sulfide oxidation and oxide precipitation, and sulfate precipitation. The porosity of the shales exhibits minor increases with carbonate dissolution, but permeability is unlikely to increase due to the isolated nature of the carbonate grains. Only when the experimental solution composition approximates formation water composition is there no change to porosity.

🔬 Passionate Researcher in Human-Computer Interaction | Affective Computing Enthusiast | Psychologist 🌟

I am a researcher in the area of Human-Computer Interaction, with a keen focus on Affective Computing. Currently, I am part of the Affective Computing Group, focusing on applications to support mental health.

My academic journey began in industrial and organizational psychology, studying job applications. Combining my expertise in psychology with cutting-edge technology, my research centers now around exploring how we can support humans by preparing them for stressful situations with the help of Socially Interactive Agents.

By bridging the gap between psychology and AI, I aspire to revolutionize the way we interact with technology. My ultimate vision is to empower machines with emotional intelligence, creating a world where technology is not only perceptive but empathetic too.

 #HCI #AffectiveComputing #AI #EmotionalIntelligence #Researcher

As an Honorary Professor at the Wenzhou Institute of Technology's Department of "Intelligent Device Manufacturing and Control," my role is at the intersection of academia and the forefront of technological innovation. I specialize in the practical application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Generative AI in intelligent device manufacturing, emphasizing the transformative potential of these technologies in shaping the future of the industry. My work also extends into the realm of Extended Reality (XR), from Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) to the burgeoning possibilities within the Metaverse.

By integrating these cutting-edge technologies into the curriculum and research projects, I am committed to preparing the next generation of engineers and innovators for the complexities of tomorrow’s manufacturing challenges. My focus on bridging the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world applications aims to foster an environment of creativity, problem-solving, and innovation. Through this, I contribute to shaping a future where the boundaries of manufacturing and digital realities converge, creating new paradigms for how we interact with, and produce, the technological marvels of the future.

My focus remains on leading innovations in Extended Reality (from VR to AR), Metaverse, AI, and GenAI, while intertwining these domains with Industry 4.0 and 5.0 concepts, all steered towards Sustainability.

headline: Associate Professor of Finance at University of Chicago Booth School of Business
occupation: Associate Professor of Finance at University of Chicago Booth School of Business
positions/0/companyName: University of Chicago Booth School of Business
positions/1/company/name: The University of Chicago Booth School of Business
positions/1/companyName: University of Chicago Booth School of Business
positions/2/company/name: University of California, Berkeley, Haas School of Business
summary:
Michael Weber joined Chicago Booth in 2014 as an Assistant Professor of Finance. His research interests include asset pricing, macroeconomics, international finance, and household finance. His work on downside risk in currency markets and other asset classes earned the 2013 AQR Insight Award and was published in the Journal of Financial Economics.

Weber is a visiting researcher at the Bureau of Labor Statistics where he studies how the inability of firms to adjust output prices to macroeconomics shocks affects their systematic risk and a member of the Macro Finance Society.

His dissertation was awarded the Top Finance Graduate Award 2014, the Best Finance PhD Award in Honor of Prof. Greenbaum 2013 (Finalist), the WFA Cubist Systematic Strategies PhD Award for Outstanding Research, the UBS Best Conference Paper Prize at the EFA Annual Meeting 2014, the 2014 EFA Best Doctoral Student Conference Paper Prize, and the Best PhD Student Paper Award, FMA European Conference 2014.

His research was covered by the Economist, Haaretz, the American Interest, Die Welt, La Stampa, among others.

Weber earned a Ph.D. and an M.S. both in Finance from the Haas School of Business at the University of California, Berkeley. Prior to his doctoral studies, he has worked in the debt advisory division of Rothschild, the Corporate Finance (M&A) advisory at KPMG, and the finance division of the Centre for European Economic Research (ZEW). He also holds a Diplom in Business Economics (with distinction) from the University of Mannheim which earned him the SEW Eurodrive dissertation award.

Weber teaches Investments at Booth. Outside of academia, he enjoys playing soccer, running, skiing, and reading.

After graduating from high school, I started studying business administration in Berlin, but realized that Psychology is my subject.

Accordingly I started studying psychology at Radboud University in Nijmegen in the Netherlands and graduated with a master's in clinical psychology.
After graduating, I started as a doctoral candidate at the University of Duisburg-Essen, where I did research in the field of teaching- and learning-psychology and did my doctorate. 
Afterwards I worked at reflact AG as a project manager and customer advisor. The focus was on didactics as well as on teaching- and learning- psychological design within digital learning environments.

Now I am working as a freelance consultant in the field of HR consulting as well as a fashion and style coaching. 

One of my main customer is a long-established HR consultancy in Düsseldorf, Personalberatung Dr. Vossen, that is specialized in carrying out talent analysis on young people, who usually come after they graduate from school, in order to be able to objectively point out their strengths. This makes it easier for clients to find a suitable study subject or a suitable job.
 
In addition, I was trained as a fashion stylist at the Academy for Fashion and Design (Düsseldorf) in 2015 and took further training in fashion psychology at Radboud University. In this area I also advise, mostly private clients. Based on psychological analysis and consideration of the client's professional, family and other relevant situations and roles, I create a fashion style concept. Here the focus is on the client's authenticity and wellbeing. In some cases, the advice extends to other areas of life. Then I additionally advise (psychologically based) on furnishings and interior design.

jobTitle: Alexander von Humboldt Professor of AI

positions/0/title: Alexander von Humboldt Professor of AI
positions/1/description: Fundamental research in Machine Learning, Data Science, Optimization (especially large-scale non-nonconvex optimization), and Applied Mathematics. Looking at applications in healthcare, IoT, data-driven science, including computational materials design.
positions/2/description: Realizing the vision of OptML, bringing Optimization and ML closer through AI driven decision making.
positions/3/companyName: Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems
positions/3/description:
At MPI-IS, my focus is on the following:

* Large-scale convex and nonconvex optimization (continuous)
* Matrix analysis, optimization on manifolds, etc.
* Optimization and learning under *uncertainty*
* Optimization algorithms in the presence of noise and inexact computation.


As far as applications are concerned, my primary attention is devoted to:

* Machine learning
* Computational Statistics
* Search and Retrieval of structured data (images, video, biological data, etc.)
* Inverse problems (mostly related to imaging, computational photography, etc.)
positions/4/description: Research, Teaching (check out: http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~suvrit/teach/aopt.html ), the usual stuff.
summary:
I am a computer scientist working on machine learning and optimization; I am a hobbyist in math of various flavors, with a bias for matrix theory, geometry, and inequalities.

I work largely on theoretical topics in machine learning and data science. I am interested in all aspects of optimization for ML, especially nonconvex optimization (example applications: deep learning algorithms, adversarial models, etc.). 

On the applied side, I care about "AI for social good" -- currently I am looking at applications in healthcare. I am also interested in energy, education, nutrition, agriculture, and other areas where data driven thinking holds great promise.

Social media: http://mathoverflow.net/users/8430/suvrit

headline: Rector at Graz University of Technology
occupation: Rector at Graz University of Technology
summary:
Horst Bischof received his M.S. and Ph.D. degree in computer science from the Vienna University of Technology in 1990 and 1993. In 1998 he got his Habilitation (venia docendi) for applied computer science. Currently he is Vice Rector for Research at Graz University of Technology and Professor at the Institute for Computer Graphics and Vision at the Graz University of Technology, Austria. H. Bischof is a member of the scientific board of Joanneum Research.  His research interests include object recognition, visual learning, on-line and life-long learning, motion and tracking, visual surveillance and biometrics and medical computer vision where he has published more than 750 peer reviewed scientific papers.

Horst Bischof was General Chair of CVPR 2015 and ECCV2018. He was program co-chair of ECCV2006 and ECCV 2020. He is multiple times Area chair of all major vision conferences. He was Associate Editor for IEEE Trans. on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, Pattern Recognition, Computer and Informatics and the Journal of Universal Computer Science.

Horst Bischof is member of the European academy of sciences and has received several awards  >20 among them the Most Influential Paper over the Decade Award from MVA 2019, the Jan Konderink award at ECCV 2018 and the 29th Pattern Recognition award in 2002, the main price of the German Association for Pattern Recognition DAGM in 2007 and 2012, the Best scientific paper award at the BMCV 2007, the BMVC best demo award 2012 and the Best scientific paper awards at the ICPR 2008, ICPR2010, PCV 2010, AAPR2010 and ACCV 2012.

headline: Multi certified coding instructor trainer
occupation: Multi certified coding instructor trainer
positions/0/description: Online PD Allied Health
summary:
As the Program Director for Medical Office Administration and Medical Assisting programs at Concorde Career Institute, Orlando, FL, I am dedicated to advancing the careers of those who desire to enter the healthcare industry as allied health professionals.  I have been teaching for over 15 years, developing curriculum and performing as a subject matter expert for medical administration, coding, health information management (HIM) and medical assisting programs. I am a Senior Healthcare Coding Consultant, who is a triple certified medical coder. I have been a field auditor and have performed audit work for a variety of healthcare organizations, including hospitals, physician practices and insurance companies. Prior to being an educator and coding consulting, I was a board certified family practice physician. 

I am a Certified Coding Specialist (CCS) through AHIMA, and a Certified Physician Coder (CPC) with over ten years in the field as a licensed Professional Medical Coding Curriculum (PMCC) instructor through the AAPC and have trained thousands of learners in medical coding, of which a majority earned their Certified Professional Coder certification, and/or specialty certifications. Professional memberships include the American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA), the American Academy of Professional Coders (AAPC) and the American Medical Association (AMA). I am an AHIMA approved ICD-10-CM and PCS Certified Trainer, and a member of the Association of Health Care Auditors and Educators.

positions/4/description: Oversee daily and breaking video content, as well as placement and social campaigns. Product owner for video technology at the Post.
summary:
How can journalists and technologists employ and engage with Artificial Intelligence in ways that build engagement and trust with news consumers? I'm at my best when faced with a pivot, a new technology, or transitioning great teams to what comes next. 

In my previous role as head of the Next Generation team at The Washington Post, we launched The 7 podcast, Style Sessions and a new team of political reporters who publish social-first. Before that, I was deputy director of video. I oversaw our daily and breaking news team and helped launch the Visual Forensics unit. Name a video format or platform, and I probably helped lead our experimentation! 

I've also had the chance to work closely with our product team as the newsroom product owner for video, where I helped build the technology stack that became part of Arc XP.
 
Let's talk about digital strategy, cross-fuctional teams and how the news industry can harness moments of change.

headline: Associate Professor at North Dakota State University
jobTitle: Associate Editor for Physical Review E
occupation: Associate Professor at North Dakota State University
positions/0/description: I edit the Computational Physics section of Physical Review E.
positions/0/title: Associate Editor for Physical Review E
positions/1/description: I am currently serving as the chairman for the annual Discrete Simulation of Fluid Dynamics conference series (see http://dsfd.org). The conferences are a venue for researchers interested in the development and application of discrete simulation methods for fluid dynamics like lattice Boltzmann, lattice gas, dissipative particle dynamics, multiparticle collision dynamics, Monte Carlo and Molecular Dynamics. The conference location is rotating between the Americas, Asia and Europa.
positions/2/description: I do research on complex fluids using the lattice Boltzmann method. I am currently interested in Phase-Separation fronts and fluctuating lattice Boltzmann.
positions/3/description: I worked with Mike Cates on modeling complex fluids with lattice Boltzmann. In particular we worked on problems related to phase-separation, phase-ordering under shear, inertial effects on droplet break-up and developing Lees-Edwards boundary conditions  for the lattice Boltzmann method.
positions/4/description: Department of Materials Science
summary:
My research focuses on the dynamics of complex fluids in general. I am working on phase-separation and evaporation phenomena using computer simulations. The simulation method we use is called lattice Boltzmann, a model based on microscopic physical ideas to obtain large scale hydrodynamics simulations.
Additionally I am the editor of the computational physics section of Physical Review E. The computational physics section is special in that it publishes articles on either new computational methods or significant advances in existing methods for any physics application, even if this application would typically be handled by a different Physical Review journal.

summary:
Thinking out of the box, doing stuff for the first time? I love it! As a studied Mechanical Engineer, I´ve never believed to become a Technology Strategist at one of the leading technology companies on the planet. But Digital Transformation fascinated me throughout my professional career. In the early years, I replaced drawing boards with CAD on PC´s, Paper-based lists with Databases and helped to bring a PC on every desk. After constant changes in the Tech-Industry, we´re now extending human ingenuity with Artificial Intelligence, and create a new world of Mobility in the Automotive Industry.
The passion for Automotive was one of the stable anchors in my career, and with this, I´m proud to serve Daimler globally.
In my spare time, I love to play Drums & Percussion. And also here, Change is the constant. Starting  in a Rock-Band, I play now in a Brass Orchestra together with 7 other Drummers, and in small Big Band (can something Big be small?). Playing Drumset, Mallets & Percussion is so inspiring, relaxing and pure joy. Since beginning of 2019, I play again in a Rock Band called "Charly Brown´s Parents"( https://charly-browns-parents.chayns.net/ )!
Most important is the family life. We can talk about when we met several times ;-)

Do you like to discuss how technology can change your role or business at Daimler? Get in contact with me and have a chat.

headline: Founder & CEO of Caster Connection

occupation: Founder & CEO of Caster Connection
positions/0/description:
Founded Caster Connection in 1987 from the trunk of a car, launching a single-person small business offering casters and installation to clients with a focus on the automotive industry. Grew company exponentially through dedication to developing the most innovative and optimal solutions to clients, ultimately moving business to thriving central location in Columbus, Ohio. Led company as the industry leader in delivering ergonomically crafted casters and wheels to thousands of clients globally, partnering with the most admired brands to offer the best casters for their needs in a highly competitive product climate. Developed extensive product lines including CC Vintage, a handpicked selection of vintage casters to uniquely complement antiques and steampunk-inspired furniture. Maintained leadership of WBENC-certified woman-owned business.

➤ Maintained competitive edge and leader status, despite drastic industry changes as a result of technological advances, by remaining dedicated to the mission and hard work that first successfully launched the small business from the trunk of a car in 1987. Capitalized on opportunities by pioneering online sales of casters to businesses and direct to consumers.

➤ Dedicated to a thriving team of 35 employees, evidence of a knack for hiring the right people, placing them in the right roles, and consistently offering strong value for a fair and empowering work environment, competitive salaries, promotions and professionalism. The results has been employee loyalty, longevity, and ultimately, company pride in every caster.

➤ Prioritized relationship development and collaboration with clients, going the extra mile to meet face to face, whenever possible, and leaning on technology, persistence, approachability, and creative solutions to facilitate constant and open communication with clients, resulting in greater mindshare with buyers, clients, and consumers.
positions/1/company/name: The Ohio State University Fisher College of Business
positions/1/companyName: The Ohio State University Fisher College of Business
summary:
For more than thirty years, Sally Hughes has consistently delivered on two things to contribute to the notable excellence and growth of her business: (1) wholeheartedly led her company with passion, integrity. and determination, and (2) persistently offered product excellence in the niche caster industry. These accomplishments are not simply at the center of Caster Connection, the company she founded in 1987; rather. they are also at the core of who Sally is as a person: passion, integrity, determination, persistence, and a commitment to superiority. It is no wonder Sally has become a trusted industry leader in the production, manufacturing, and distribution of casters.

★    ★    ★ 

Now leading a multimillion-dollar company with 35+ employees, a thriving full-scale warehouse in accessible Columbus, Ohio, and partnerships with thousands of clients across the world, Sally is a dogged visionary with a long reputation for delivering superior products. Her success rests in her willingness to invite team members, clients, buyers, and consumers into the troubleshooting and product development process, guaranteeing that the casters and wheels that Caster Collection offers are reliable, tested, dependable, and the best fit to meet specific market needs.

★    ★    ★ 

Sally’s lifetime of success has led her to extensive opportunities to give back to and serve her community including work with children’s hospitals, schools, young entrepreneurs, and women in leadership. A few of the organizations she serves include the Women’s Leadership Network Advisory Board (Otterbein University), the Women's Business Enterprise Council Ohio River Valley (WBEC ORV), the Ohio Chamber of Commerce, The Wellington School, the National Association of Women Business Owners (NAWBO), and the Women Presidents’ Organization (WPO). 

★    ★    ★ 

Sally was an appointed member of Attorney General Mike DeWine’s Ohio Consumers’ Counsel, and she served as the Women’s Small Business Accelerator Board’s (WSBA) 2019 Gala Chairperson, raising more money and attracting more attendees than ever before in an effort to bring awareness to this relatively new program for women. In 2016, she was honored as the Ohio Small Business Person of the Year, and twice she has been recognized as an Honoree for the Columbus Smart 50 Award.

★    ★    ★ 

Contact 800-544-8978 to order the samples or to ask any questions. You can also visit our website:
www.casterconnection.com

summary:
Wolfgang was born on May 12, 1983 in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, but grew up in the small town of Perth just outside of the city. He's one of 4 brothers.  His father Wolfgang Joseph Weber Sr. is a retired Mechanical Engineer, and his mother Catherine, worked as a stay at home mother.  Between 2004–2008, Wolfgang’s first TV appearance was on the CTV Canadian mini series “H2O” and soon after he moved to Florida in pursuit of his acting career.  While there he had booked small forgettable roles in a variety of commercials, shorts films and features.  However, his run of luck led him to second guess his acting career and embark on a career in law enforcement. 
 
After being denied time off for an audition, he decided to quit his job and go full force into acting by moving to Los Angeles, California leaving his law enforcement career behind.  For the first seven months he stayed in a hostel in South Los Angeles, and had lied to his parents about his living situation to not worry them.  It was only a few days and Wolfgang had signed with a manager.  From there he landed co star roles on various shows such as Cartoon Networks “Incredible Crew” & “CSI Miami”. Wolfgang was finally seeing the light at the end of the tunnel by being cast in the thriller “Into the Darkness” starring alongside Twilights Kiowa Gordon, but do to financing issues, the film never got made after a years worth of press.  Although the film was never made, Wolfgang and some of the cast memebers did end up working together on the film “Heatwave”. Since then Wolfgang has starred in many indie films like “All American Zombie Drugs”,  “The Magicians Son”, “Resurgent” and can be seen on a variety of hit YouTube Channels, including his own.  You can also catch him in the features “Cynthia”, “Interpreters” and Lifetime's "Devious Nanny" all premiering in 2017.

headline: environmental toxicologist interested in what plastics do to human and ecosystem health
occupation: environmental toxicologist interested in what plastics do to human and ecosystem health
positions/0/company/name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
positions/0/companyName: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
positions/0/description: Martin is a biologist interested in studying what plastics and other snythetic agents (e.g., endocrine disrupting chemicals) do to human and ecosystem health. For that he uses state-of-the-art in vitro and in vivo bioassays to characterize the total toxicity of complex samples (e.g., leachates of plastic materials). He also applies effect-directed chemical analysis to identify novel compounds causing the observed toxicity. With this approach he aims at contributing to a more holistic understanding human and environmental exposomes. To achieve this, he is working at the interface of mechanistic toxicology, exposure science, non-target chemical analysis, and environmental health.
positions/1/description:
I am heading a junior research team at the Dept. Aquatic Ecotoxicology at the Goethe University Frankfurt. As a diverse team of environmental toxicologists we investigate the effects of chemicals on multiple biological levels. Current research projects focus on endocrine disruptors and plastics as well as improving waste water treatment technologies to remove trace pollutants in the water cycle.
My focus as team leader is on communication, cooperation, and creativity. My tasks include project management, attracting extramural funding, establishing international cooperations, structuring and publishing research.
positions/2/description: I ran a research project dealing with the assessment of endocrine disrupting chemicals in the aquatic environment using different bioassays. The project aimed at providing comprehensive data to facilitate the application of bioassays in a regulatory contexts as well as international standardization.
positions/3/companyName: MP of the State Parliament of Hesse
positions/3/description: As personal assistant of a Member of Parliament I did background research on science policy, prepared drafts of parliamentary initiatives, wrote speeches and press releases.

summary:
As a mother of two humans and 2 dogs, a Leadership Development Specialist and Professional Coach, Laura C. Hoffmann, PhD., works with working parents and individual employees.  Dr. Hoffmann’s leadership expertise is a mixture of education, experience, and research.  Her passion is helping employees and organizations work together better to create lasting impact and continued growth.

Dr. Hoffmann won the Boeing Diversity and Inclusion Award as a result of her work with the Boeing Women in Leadership group as a leader for the Parents Network.  She also received a certificate of appreciation from Boeing Finance People Development because of her work as a lead curriculum designer and new hire cohort leader.

With a PhD from The Chicago School of Professional Psychology, Dr. Hoffmann’s specialties include organizational leadership, leadership theory and behavior, coaching, and organizational culture.  Dr. Hoffmann’s work has been to understand how large organizations function. 

As part of her continued leadership development Dr. Hoffmann joined the Boeing St. Louis Leadership Association (BSLLA) as a member of the Board of Directors in 2015.  Dr. Hoffmann also obtained a Strategic Leader certification from the Rady School of business and has obtained additional certifications in coaching such as Inside Out Coaching.

Dr. Hoffmann has given several leadership development workshops to nonprofit organizations within the St. Louis area and has been working as a life coach for clients in the St. Charles and St. Peters since 2017.

headline: Full Professor @ University of Stuttgart | Head of Digitalization, AI, and Machine Vision @ Fraunhofer IPA
honors/0/description: Habilitation (from Latin habilis "fit, proper, skillfull"​) is the highest academic qualification a scholar can achieve by his or her own pursuit in many countries in Europe, Central Asia, and the Caucasus. Earned after obtaining a research doctorate, such as a PhD, habilitation requires that the candidate write a professorial thesis (or habilitation thesis) based on independent scholarship, reviewed by and defended before an academic committee in a process similar to that of the doctoral dissertation. However, the level of scholarship has to be considerably higher than that required for a research doctoral (PhD) thesis in terms of quality and quantity, and must be accomplished independently, in contrast with a PhD dissertation typically directed or guided by a faculty supervisor. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Habilitation)

I'm the Deputy Director of the Institute of Industrial Manufacturing and Management IFF at University of Stuttgart. At the same time I'm Scientific Director for Digitalization and Artificial Intelligence and Head of the Research Unit Artificial Intelligence and Machine Vision, both with Fraunhofer IPA in Stuttgart, Germany. As a full professor (W3) for cognitive production systems I manage and conduct R&D projects on artificial intelligence and machine learning in manufacturing, automation, and robotics.

My teams at the University of Stuttgart and Fraunhofer IPA offer research and development support, consultancy, and data science expertise in the following fields:

👉 innovative business models and strategic consulting 
👉 data-driven products and services

👉 digital twins for manufacturing systems
👉 machine learning in manufacturing and automation
👉 dependable, explainable, and trustworthy AI
