👉 data efficient AI and informed machine learning
👉 machine vision
👉 generative AI  
👉 quality control
👉 quantum computing and machine learning

With our experience from several hundred projects we know how to transform research results into benefits for the industry.

summary: Kay Firth-Butterfield is CEO of Good Tech Advisory LLC and one of four TIME Impact awardees 2024. The former inaugural Head of AI at the World Economic Forum she is one of the foremost experts in the world on the governance of AI. She writes a monthly column on AI for THE INNOVATOR and is an Executive Advisor to THE CANTELLUS GROUP. Kay is a Barrister, former Judge and Professor, technologist and entrepreneur who has an abiding interest in how humanity can equitably benefit from new technologies, especially AI.  Kay is an Associate Barrister (Doughty Street Chambers), Master of the Inner Temple, London and served on the Lord Chief Justice’s Advisory Panel on AI and Law. In 2014, was the world’s first Chief AI Ethics officer.  She is a Senior Research Fellow at the University of Texas, a Visiting Scholar at the University of Notre Dame and was Vice-Chair of The IEEE Global Initiative for Ethical Considerations in Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Systems and was part of the group which met to create the Asilomar AI Ethical Principles. She is on the Polaris Council for the Government Accountability Office (USA), and the Advisory Board for UNESCO International Research Centre on AI. She sits on the Board of Earth Species Project and AI Advisory Boards of FATHOM, ADI, SWISSRE and QURATOR. Also, Kay serves on the World Economic Forum's Global Future Council on AI, their AI Governance Alliance and Digital Healthcare Alliance. Kay has advanced degrees in Law and International Relations and regularly speaks to international audiences addressing many aspects of the beneficial and challenging technical, economic and social changes arising from the use of AI. She has been consistently recognized as a leading woman in AI since 2018 and was featured in the New York Times as one of 10 Women Changing the Landscape of Leadership, in 2021

skills/2: Mapping Function and Structure in the Human Brain
summary: Martin Meyer and his group are interested in all aspects of the relationship between brain and language. We ask how (spoken) language is used to understand the brain, and how the brain is used to understand (spoken) language. Using the full arsenal of modern neuroimaging approaches, we have investigated how right and left hemispheres contribute to decoding and understanding spoken utterances. In particular, we are interested in the influences of different forms of hearing loss and brain atrophy on the neuroplasticity of speech comprehension in different languages. Currently, we are working on a model of the evolutionary properties and origins of prosody and speech rhythm and their links to neural circuits of the motor system and aim to fathom the neural underpinning of structure planning during language production. Another area of our research examines the basis and treatment options for central hearing disorders, particularly chronic subjective tinnitus and its limiting effect on speech understanding and everyday communication.

headline: Professor at Hasso Plattner Institute
occupation: Professor at Hasso Plattner Institute
positions/0/description: As member of SAP's supervisory board, I focus on product & technology as well as finance & investments.
positions/2/description:
Chair for Artificial Intelligence and Sustainability research group.

I believe that an energy-aware perspective is imperative for developing true artificial intelligence and that an AI-first approach is imperative for solving the challenge of transitioning to a sustainable future based on renewable energy. My research is organized under two broad themes: (1) Energy in Artificial Intelligence (the use of energy in developing AI). This area encapsulates research on the tradeoffs and limitations of energy usage in solving basic AI tasks such as classification, ranking or planning & search. The notion of what constitutes AI in a machine is most famously captured by the notion of the Turing test. Currently, this is an unfair test because AI systems that offer impressive performance on tasks in restricted domains (e.g., AlphaGo) are not judged fairly: while the human brain uses around 20W-25W of energy to perform such feasts, current AI methods use orders more energy today. Energy-efficient AI methods will also be required in the years to come to reduce their energy footprint in edge and cloud computing scenarios. (2) Artificial Intelligence in Energy (the use of AI technology in generating, storing and managing energy). This area encapsulates research into the development and application of state-of-the-art AI methods to particular problems arising from the larger reliance on renewable energy, starting with more refined modeling of batteries to enable the extension of their working lifetime, all the way to the development of AI methods for control of domestic energy consumption, necessitating research into computational privacy and explainable AI.
positions/3/description:
betteries is a profit for impact start-up based in Berlin, Germany that up-cycles batteries from electric vehicles (EV) into connected affordable power systems to avert climate change and protect valuable resources - fully embracing the principles of a circular economy.

With our AI work, we are focusing on both estimating the state of health of EV batteries and optimizing their lifetime during second life.
summary:
In general, I want my work to have a positive impact to many people's lives. I particularly enjoy the application of principled research to large-scale real-world problems. I enjoy learning new things every day and getting to work with (new) people. 

I fundamentally believe in a people-first approach: As a scientist, I want to solve problems that people really have - also called "working backwards" and "customer-obsession"; as a manager, I always put people (development) over project (success) - the former being "the end" and the latter being "the means" (not the other way around); as a scientific leader, I always prefer to discuss ideas with another scientist over just reading their work - learning happens faster and in a more sustained way in a dialog rather than in reading.

I do not accept existing scientific boundaries and think that the largest breakthroughs will be made at the intersection of existing disciplines. My research interests include Bayesian inference and decision making, game theory, information retrieval, natural language processing, computer vision, distributed systems, learning theory and knowledge representation and reasoning. I have published over 80 peer reviewed conference and journal papers in these fields. 

I am one of the inventors of the Drivatars™ system in the Forza Motorsport series as well as the TrueSkill™ ranking and matchmaking system in Xbox 360 Live. I also co-invented the click-prediction technology used in bing's online advertising system (adPredictor) which is used widely in the industry now. I am co-inventor for several patents relating to these inventions.

summary:
I am a data science | AI researcher and consultant focusing on GenAI | LLM | NLP | RAG | Multi-Agent System (MAS) technologies. In my client and internal R&D projects, I build those systems (PoCs, demos, and in production), and give seminars and trainings about prompt engineering for ChatGPT, Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, and other closed- and open-source models. Starting my life as a Northern German countryside boy from a non-academic background, my journey has taken many improbable paths*. There are still many things I’d like to do, but if none of them came true, that would also be okay. 

Some of my guiding principles:
• life and the universe have no intrinsic goal – what we call purpose or meaningful are the things we value, and that's all that's needed        (to make their pursuit worthwhile and life beautiful)
• people first        (or the ultimate goal should be the flourishing of sentient beings)
• don't treat others like you wouldn't want to be treated (silver rule), treat others like you would like to be treated (golden), treat others like they would like to be treated (diamond)
• freedom, equality, and justice       (everyone should get a fair chance to flourish in their way)
• everything is transient        (and one primary cause for suffering is non-acceptance of this reality through craving and aversion)
• our selves are made up of multiple selves (recognition of this fact allows us to integrate our conflicting parts)
• judge an action by its consequences in context (don't get stuck on principles)
• done is better than perfect        (good enough is better than not done)

Making the world a better place is a noble but difficult goal. In my view, Effective Altruism (EA) is one of the better ways to care about global priority topics and the long-term future before we run out of time to find infinity.

My hobbies past and present include fine arts, photography, guitar, reading, juggling, jogging, linguistics, Ultimate Frisbee, swimming, cycling, triathlons, yoga, Lindy Hop dancing, and Vipassana meditation. 

If you are curious or inspired to connect, feel free to reach out and we can explore things together!

*Also including stints as a volunteer for people with special needs in Aberdeen, Scotland, and as a journalist in Lomé, Togo.

His works range from classical art music to popular music, the latter best exemplified in his recording, "Sonnet," which has gained international accolades and is featured on streaming music services, radio, film and television, and other media.

Classical beginnings: Conservatorium of Music training (Sydney), Sydney Symphony Orchestra, Australian Chamber Orchestra.

Three Royal Command Performances for the British Royal family.

Check out www.martinlass.com

CashBox Media delivers targeted advertising to in-store audiences, just minutes before they make a purchase. 

In April of 2023 we developed the idea of Advertising on ATMs to help cannabis brands gain more exposure in the competitive dispensary landscape and help individual stores drive more non-plant touching revenue. 

Today, we have access to more than 110,000 ATMs doing billions of transactions across multiple retail verticals including dispensaries, gas stations, convenience stores, stadiums, nail salons and more, so you can reach millions of customers with cash in their hands.

My line is open - want to reach millions of shoppers? Place an ad. Need an ATM for your dispensary or store? Get a free ATM from the most trusted company in cash management.

In my position at Chill Steel Pipes, my focus is concentrated on enhancing our operations to ensure our readiness for seasonal demands and reduce turnaround time and costs, ultimately enhancing customer satisfaction.

Since joining the team, we have seen a record year by increasing our reach, sales, and conversion rate by 15-65%. I have moved tens of thousands of water pipes across the country to happy customers and trusted partners, delivering a product that is Built to Chill and Designed to Evolve.
positions/3/description:
Our goal was to build modern storage solutions for modern medicine to enhance the consumer's health and wellness experience through discreet and stylish storage options.

Founded at the age of 19, NEKKTAR was born from the personal need for cannabis and medication storage. Successfully sold majority ownership of BUZZBOXX by NEKKTAR to new owners in Los Angeles, California.
positions/4/description:
During my time with Cann, I learned firsthand the impact of consumer education in the cannabis industry. When we take the time to slow down, educate new consumers about the benefits, forms, and functions of cannabis and microdosing, it can have an incredible impact on both consumers and the brand. 

Our trade and field marketing campaigns in Boston during the Summer of 2022 tremendously enhanced visibility of the brand, understanding of the plant with consumers, and ultimately led to increased sales— a testament to the power of education in a rapidly evolving industry.
summary:
👋🏽 Hi, I'm Julia Loni Turner -- I'm deeply immersed in the world of cash, cannabis, and advertising, live for the joy and pain of sports, love to show up in the hottest new sneakers, bring humility to the financial literacy journey, strive for operational excellence, and am a Gen Zer with an old soul.

🧊 Currently, I am the Operations Manager at Chill Steel Pipes and Founder and CEO of CashBox Media. I sold my first company BUZZBOXX by NEKKTAR after 5.5 years as founder and remain a minority owner.

🍃 I am committed to rethinking the cannabis industry through socially aware entrepreneurship. After suffering 4 severe concussions in high school, cannabis single-handedly helped me recover from post-concussion syndrome and I was introduced to the benefits of microdosing cannabis daily. I will forever advocate for the plant that helped me, and so many others.

📚 I studied Public Policy at Duke University and I deeply love the state of North Carolina, specifically the Raleigh-Durham area.

😈 I grew up an athlete and have been drawn to almost every sport on the planet; catch me watching the best of Women and Men’s basketball, tennis, volleyball, baseball, softball, racing, swimming -- you name it, and I will be watching it.

👟 The freshest pair of sneakers in my closet are the Jordan 3 Retro in Rust Pink. 

💭 Embracing the humility of always being on a financial literacy journey — whether in entrepreneurship or personal finance.

💃🏽 Dancing through life with the energy of Gen Z and the heart of an old soul.


📧 If ANYTHING on my profile caught your eye, reach out me — I’d love to talk. Through my experiences, I hope to show that we can bring our true selves to work and thrive.

        💵 julia@cashbox-media.com --- www.cashbox-media.com
	🧊 julia@chill.store --- www.chill.store
        🐝 julia@nekktar.com --- wwww. nekktar.com

headline: President and CEO @ Care New England | Physician Executive
occupation: President and CEO @ Care New England | Physician Executive
positions/2/title: Interim President and Chief Executive Officer
positions/3/description:
Tufts Medical Center is an exceptional, not-for-profit, 415-bed academic medical center that is home to both a full-service hospital for adults and Floating Hospital for Children. Conveniently located in downtown Boston, the Medical Center is the principal teaching hospital for Tufts University School of Medicine. Floating Hospital for Children is the full-service children's hospital of Tufts Medical Center and the principal pediatric teaching hospital of Tufts University School of Medicine. Tufts Medical Center is affiliated with the New England Quality Care Alliance, a network of more than 1,800 physicians throughout Eastern Massachusetts.

a.	Executive leadership of principle teaching hospital for Tufts University School of Medicine and academic medical center in downtown Boston with total revenue of $756 million and margin of 4.5%
b.	Creation of Wellforce, a new parent organization with community hospital partner - Circle Health/Lowell General Hospital to create a platform for innovation and consumer based healthcare
c.	Set organizational goals and implement programs to improve performance in patient access, patient experience, employee engagement, quality/safety and operational performance 
d.	Continued expansion of cardiovascular, surgical and pediatric service lines
e.	Active voice at State House and with the media on topics of value based healthcare and creating a balanced healthcare marketplace
positions/4/description:
Tufts Medical Center Physicians Organization is comprised of 550 academic physicians in 17 departments. In addition to providing services to Tufts MC we also provide services to the community through our Distributed Academic Medical Center model with over 50 offsite locations of care, including managing hospitalist, intensivist, primary care and specialty clinics.

At the core of our mission are our patients and their families. We strive to provide the most compassionate, patient centric care. The physicians of Tufts Medical Center provide the most advanced medical care that is appropriate, safe and effective. We aim to provide these services in the most cost effective manner in order to be the value provider in Boston and eastern Massachusetts. We continue the academic mission of Tufts University School of Medicine and Tufts Medical Center by training the next generation of physicians. We strive to advance medical knowledge by supporting innovation and research that has a tangible impact on lives of our patients here in Boston and across the entire medical field.

The physicians organization is focused on three essential strategies as we adapt to the changing landscape of healthcare: 1) To recruit the retain the best physician talent, 2) To further the clinical and financial integration between the Medical Center and the Physicians Organization, 3) To distribute our physician services in order to bring care to the communities we serve and to further the tertiary mission of the Medical Center.

The physicians organization accomplishes these goals by advancing four basic management principles: 1) Clarity of purpose as outlined in our mission. Clarity in roles, tactics and accountability, 2) Engagement by bringing physicians, nurses, administrative professionals and other members of the healthcare team together to maximize the most value resource we have - our people. 3) Objectivity and the use of metrics, 4) Transparency in decision making and in sharing of data.
positions/4/title: President and CEO, Tufts Medical Center Physicians Organization
summary: As the President and CEO of Care New England, I lead one of the largest health systems in Rhode Island, with a vision to provide high-quality, affordable, and patient-centered care to the communities we serve. With over 35 years of experience as a physician executive, I have a proven track record of transforming healthcare delivery and outcomes through innovation, collaboration, and accountability.

summary:
Tom Bergmann is an accomplished President, Chief Financial Officer, and seasoned board member with 35+ years of operating experience with public, private-equity and employee-owned companies. Tom has extensive global experience in developing and implementing strategic plans, acquiring and integrating businesses, executing capital market transactions (including an IPO) and driving financial performance. Tom has a proven track record of creating value across multiple industries with premium companies including Honeywell, Johnson & Johnson, Harley-Davidson and Life Time.

Tom brings deep corporate governance experience having worked with public and private company audit, finance and compensation committees throughout his career.  He is qualified to serve on audit committees as a financial expert. Tom has served as a member of SRAM Corporation’s board of directors for the past 12 years where he is also the Chair of the Audit Committee.  

Tom previously served on non-profit boards including Big Brothers Big Sisters of Milwaukee and as Vice Chairman of the Boys & Girls Clubs of Chicago.

Tom received his Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of St. Thomas and his Masters in Management from the Kellogg School of Business at Northwestern University.

Tom holds a commercial pilot certificate and two jet type ratings and is an active endurance athlete having completed four Ironman triathlons and seven Leadville 100 mountain bike races.

Together with our customers, we try to better understand the current business state and challenges that come across on their journey of digital transformation. By envisioning our Analytics and AI solutions and architecting usecases individually to each customer scenario, we find joint approaches on how to overcome these obstacles in an end-to-end motion.
summary:
My starting point:
My journey has been a continuous exploration of technology. With a Bachelor's Degree in International Business that I pursued with a dual program studies at Adobe, a pivotal moment in my career was when I made the shift at Microsoft from a Partner Business Development role to a technical Pre-Sales role for AI as part of an internal pilot for young professionals.

My mission:
I wanted to take things a step further with a Dual Degree in Madrid: an International MBA & Master's Degree in Big Data & Analytics. This journey got me hands-on experience in data preparation and exploratory analysis, programming in Python and R, building machine learning models, performing Spark analysis, and creating recommendation engines and computer vision systems. These acquired skills now empower me to better understand and address the everyday challenges faced by my customers.

My vision: 
My aspiration is to make technology more understandable and accessible to people, helping them realize its potential to revolutionize every industry. In my point of view, there still is a disconnect between business departments and IT, and my goal is to bridge this gap, unlocking the untapped opportunities that lie ahead.

headline: Superintendent of Catholic Schools
occupation: Superintendent of Catholic Schools
positions/2/companyName: St. Gregory the Great Catholic School
positions/2/locationName: St. Gregory the Great Catholic School
positions/4/companyName: St. Gregory the Great Catholic School
positions/4/description: Grade 7 Team Leader; Mathematics Teacher, Grades 7-8; Committee member revising Archdiocesan Mathematics curriculum guidelines; Student Council and IOWA Testing Coordinator; Part-Time Curriculum specialist for grades 3-8;
summary:
For the past year and a half Maria Wagner has led the Catholic Schools in the Diocese of Springfield.  Prior to relocating to Massachusetts, Ms. Wagner served for over 20 year in the Archdiocese of Miami as principal of St. Bernadette Catholic School, and teaching and developing curriculum at St. Gregory Catholic School. Her teaching career began in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia where she began her teaching career.  While in Saudi Arabia, Ms. Wagner taught sixth grade, helped develop the science curriculum and presented at the Near East South Asia (NESA) Teaching Conference in Istanbul, Turkey.  Upon returning to the US, she taught mathematics at St. Agnes Catholic School in Virginia.  
 
In terms of her formal background, Ms. Wagner has a master’s degree in Educational Technology Leadership from George Washington University and a bachelor of science in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Notre Dame.  She is currently accredited in Florida in Educational Leadership and Mathematics Grades 5 – 9.  Prior to her teaching career, Ms. Wagner worked as a mechanical engineer for Pratt & Whitney and TRW.  She is fully fluent in Spanish.
 
Maria Wagner has always had a special connection to students even when she was working as an engineer with Pratt & Whitney and then TRW. With her bilingual fluency in Spanish and English, she took special interest in mentoring minority girls in math, attending career days at local schools to talk to students about the importance of mathematics in our daily world, and she helped at judging science fairs.
 
Maria Wagner is committed to excellence in academics and continuously seeks best practices and instructional strategies such as brain-based learning and continual technology integration. She considers herself a visionary leader in that she recognizes school needs, creates specific, achievable goals, initiates action and enlists the participation and commitment of the school faculty/staff. Some of her achievements include creating a collaborative professional learning environment that provides teachers consistency in the curriculum, providing opportunities for professional development, and implementing the most effective curriculum standards.  Ms. Wagner has successfully led schools through the school accreditation process and helped develop mission/vision statements and strategic plans.

headline: PwC | Artificial Intelligence Partner | Transformation – Technology – Trust | Startup Investor and Advisor
occupation: PwC | Artificial Intelligence Partner | Transformation – Technology – Trust | Startup Investor and Advisor
summary:
Veränderungen sind nicht immer leicht, aber in unserem Digitalzeitalter nötig, um zu bestehen und zu wachsen. Ich unterstütze Unternehmen bei ihren Transformationsprozessen, helfe ihnen, Probleme und Herausforderungen zu erkennen und langfristige Lösungen zu implementieren. 

Bei PwC bin ich als Partner spezialisiert auf #AI und unterstütze Kunden, die Technologie verantwortungsvoll einsetzen zu können. Change ist mein Antrieb. Um Künstliche Intelligenz erfolgreich im Betrieb zu operationalisieren, braucht es neben der Transformation und Technologie auch Vertrauen als essentielle Zutat. Meine tiefe Überzeugung ist, dass Trust Kern erfolgreicher Geschäftsmodelle ist. 
In über zwanzig Jahren Berufserfahrung habe auch ich einige Veränderungen durchlaufen - von Cyber, über Cloud zu AI und vom (Co-)Gründer über verschiedene Consulting Stationen zu PwC. 

Diesen Erfahrungsschatz nutze ich, um meine Kunden strategisch und mit Weitblick durch ihre individuelle Transformation zu navigieren. Um die besten Lösungen für unsere Kund*innen und die Gesellschaft zu finden, bewegen wir uns immer vor der Welle - mit dem Ziel, erfolgreiche Lösungen für eine neue digitale Zukunft zu gestalten.

headline: Professor in Computer Engineering and Member of the Board of Directors at LRZ
jobTitle: Professor / Chair for Computer Architecture and Parallel Systems
occupation: Professor in Computer Engineering and Member of the Board of Directors at LRZ
positions/0/title: Professor / Chair for Computer Architecture and Parallel Systems
positions/1/title: Member of the Board of Directors
positions/2/description: Martin's research interests include parallel and distributed architectures and applications; performance monitoring, modeling and analysis; memory system optimization; parallel programming paradigms; tool support for parallel programming; power efficiency for parallel systems; and fault tolerance at the application and system level. In his position at LLNL he especially focuses on the issue of scalability for parallel applications, code correctness tools, and parallel performance analyzers. Martin has won several awards, including the prestigious Gordon Bell Prize in 2006. He is a member of the ACM and the IEEE Computer Society.
positions/3/description: Research in Computer Architecture, non-intrusive monitoring systems, and reliability protocols for message passing systems.
summary:
Martin Schulz is a Full Professor and Chair for Computer Architecture and Parallel Systems at the Technische Universität München (TUM), which he joined in 2017, as well as a member of the board of directors at the Leibniz Supercomputing Centre. Prior to that, he held positions at the Center for Applied Scientific Computing (CASC) at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) and Cornell University. He earned his Doctorate in Computer Science in 2001 from TUM and a Master of Science in Computer Science from UIUC.

Martin's research interests include parallel and distributed architectures and applications; performance monitoring, modeling and analysis; memory system optimization; parallel programming paradigms; tool support for parallel programming; power-aware parallel computing; and fault tolerance at the application and system level, as well as quantum computing and quantum computing architectures and programming, with a special focus on HPC and QC integration.

Martin has published over 250 peer-reviewed papers and currently serves as the chair of the MPI Forum, the standardization body for the Message Passing Interface, one of the dominating standard in High-Performance Computing. He was a recipient of the IEEE/ACM Gordon Bell Award in 2006 and an R&D 100 award in 2011. He served on many conference and workshop organizing and program committees, including as program chair for ISC 2021, PC area chair at IPDPS 2021 and general chair of EuroMPI 2021.

summary: Petra co- founded the AI.GROUP (AI.HAMBURG, AI.FUND, AI.IMPACT)to bring International AI expertise to businesses, excellarate the adoption of AI. She also co-founded AI.INVEST and AI.FUND to support the growth of promising AI start ups with venture capital and expertise. She co-founded the AI STARTUP HUB in Hamburg, which is funded by the German Government. She co-founded Transatlantic AI Exchange to deepen the exchange between the US and Germany between experts in the AI ecosystem. Petra is a pioneer in the mobile industry.She is one oft the first women globally to co- found a mobile company in 2005 and has been successful in growing Smaato to become one of the largest independent mobile companies in the world and the largest independent Global Mobile Ad and RTB Exchanges with HQ in San Francisco and offices in New York, Hamburg, Singapore and Jakarta. As founding member of Intershop in 1996, Petra was instrumental in growing the company from a start-up to a publicly listed company with a market cap of $12Billion. As VP of Business Development and Strategic Alliances Petra had global responsibility for all strategic, business and technical partnerships.Petra has over 30 years of business experience in the US, Europe and Asia. Petra is a Silicon Valley veteran since 1981, one of the best globally networked women executives. She sits on several boards and has been appointed to international honorary positions. She is AI Chair at GABA, the German American Business Association. She is a member of the Committee for Innovation and Research at the Hamburg Chamber of Commerce, a Board Member of Hamburg@work, a Board Member at the Amerikazentrum and Vice President at The American Club. She was on the Global Leadership Team of Women in Wireless where she facilitates the organisations Global expansion. Petra was appointed Hamburg Ambassador to San Francisco by the former Governor and First Mayor of Hamburg, Olaf Scholz, now Germany's Chancellor. She was appointed International Ambassador of the Technical University of Hamburg(TUHH) by the president. She is on the Board of the ECIU University (The European Consortium of Innovative Universities), a EU funded University with a new challenge based educational system on European scale.Petra was named Mobile Women to Watch 2010 by Mobile Marketer, Top Female Executive 2010 by Mobile Entertainment,Women Entrepreneur Who Launched A Successful Mobile Startup 2012 in Forbes and One Of The Most Powerful And Most Influential Women In The Mobile Advertising Industry 2015 by Business Insider.

summary:
I am a global leader in the field of financial artificial intelligence. I lead a quant development team of 40+ at EndoTech, where our financial AI algorithms create Alpha for institutional and HNWI investors.

I personally lead the investments and champion the AI/ML teams to capture Alpha in volatile markets. My deep-learning algorithms have managed nearly a billion dollars of investment (AuM) and have been deployed in managing institutional monies for more than a decade, including work with Gilboa fund of funds.

I have both strong technological and financial credentials and a proven track record bringing them together. My expertise lies in AI, ML, Algo-Trading, Data Science, and modeling.

I have achieved significant success in financial services, retail, and algo-trading applications. I possess an extensive business background in international markets and serve as an advanced technical leader with deep knowledge in software development and big data analytics. I am experienced in managing extremely complex offerings from both technological and operational angles.

In addition to my expertise in financial artificial intelligence, I hold a doctorate in AI and have authored published works. I am sought after as a speaker and, most importantly, I am an active practitioner.

My specialties include developing new business from scratch, raising capital, growing revenues, building operations, HR management, creating a distribution network, B2B2C marketing and advertising, managing B2B partners of Tier-1 Brokers, negotiating and closing deals, forming strategic alliances, developing and successfully introducing new products, dealing with government regulation and compliance, team building and performance improvement, and experience in M&A processes.

headline: Horticulture PhD Student at Washington State University
honors/1/description: I was awarded funding for a research project that I conducted in Dr. Laura Shannon’s lab in Fall 2020. The project tested several methods of treating premature flower abscission in dihaploid potatoes.
honors/2/description: I was selected based on my academic achievement and interest in research related to food safety technologies. This scholarship provides the opportunity to conduct food safety research in a UMN lab in Fall 2019 and Spring 2020 (research was conducted in Dr. Abdennour Abbas’ Lab). My research was focused on food safety applications of nanoparticles.
honors/3/description: I was awarded a scholarship to pay for my time and supplies for a 120-hour research project that I conducted in the Shannon Lab (potato genetics) May - August 2019. The research was focused on quantifying dihaploid induction ability of various tetraploid potato cultivars. This award was given based on a 3-page research proposal that I wrote which detailed the relevance of the research and how the project will be carried out.
honors/5/description: I completed over 250 hours of volunteer service in a 12-month period. My volunteer work was focused on literacy, education, and children. Most of my service was done at Lake Elmo Public Library, where I helped plan and run the Summer Reading Program, and Lily Lake Elementary School, where I tutored students in reading.
honors/6/description: I completed over 100 hours of volunteer service in a 12-month period. My volunteer work was focused on literacy and children. Most of my service was conducted at Lake Elmo Public Library, where I helped plan and run the Summer Reading Program, at Oak Park Elementary School, where I tutored students in reading, and at Stillwater Area High School, where I tutored students in Algebra II.

positions/2/description:
-Led Lean Six Sigma DMAIC project that successfully reduced variability in green liquor quality for an estimated annual savings of $145,000.
-Active participant in six Lean Six Sigma DMAIC projects.
-Performed routine and non-routine testing to monitor and troubleshoot process.
positions/3/description:
Shannon Lab (Horticultural Science)
-My research focused on potato breeding and genetics.
-Designed and conducted project to determine the most effective treatment for premature flower abscission in dihaploid plants (Fall 2020).
-Conducted project aimed at developing a population of diploid potatoes through hand pollination and quantifying dihaploid induction ability of several potato cultivars (Summer 2019). 
-Maintained plants in growth chambers and greenhouse through regular watering, transplanting, and taking notes on plant growth and health.
positions/4/description:
Abbas Lab (Bioproducts & Biosystems Engineering) 
-My research focused on nanoparticle synthesis and applications, including using nanoparticles to remove contaminants (phosphorus, arsenic, mercury, etc) from water and to detect pathogens (bacteria) in food. 
-Synthesized iron, copper, selenium, and titanium nanoparticles on solid supports as well as in solution for use in testing, removing contaminants from water, and developing a better understanding of the reaction mechanisms. 
-Conducted a variety of tests on selenium and iron nanoparticles in order to develop a more thorough understanding of nanoparticle application and use. 
-Utilized UV spectroscopy (prepared samples and ran tests) and X-ray diffraction (prepared samples for testing) for nanoparticle identification throughout the synthesis process to aid in understanding reaction mechanisms.
summary:
I am a PhD student in Horticulture at Washington State University, where I am working on introducing sweetpotato as a new crop in western Washington. 

In my free time, I enjoy hiking, backpacking, and gardening.

jobTitle: Program Lead | Associate Director Preclinical Development
occupation: Preclinical Development | In Vivo Pharmacology | Team Leadership | Cardiometabolic Diseases | RNA Therapeutics | Gene Editing
positions/0/description:
Lead key pipeline siRNA therapeutic projects in cardiovascular, heart failure and MASH space. Manage projects directly and in matrixed setting. Design and oversee entire project life cycle from target identification and in vitro screening through in vivo PK/PD in rodents and non-human primates (NHP), efficacy and disease proof-of-concept (PoC) and lead nomination to IND-enabling studies.

- Design preclinical strategy, source disease models, develop biomarker strategy, and identify and conduct due diligence on contract research organizations (CROs) and external collaborators. Manage interaction with CROs to drive project within timelines and budgets, ensuring compliance in steering meetings.
- Review, interpret and compile data and regularly communicate strategy and findings to key stakeholders, supporting key Go/No-Go decisions.
- Responsible for all aspects of projects, including research of disease mechanisms and unmet need, design of target product profile (TPP), project management and identification of KOLs and collaborators.
- Support asset development through cross-functional collaboration: identify partnering opportunities and support generation of pitch decks with Business Development (BD) unit; support IP strategy with legal team and survey market and competitive landscape with competitive intelligence (CI) team.
positions/0/title: Program Lead | Associate Director Preclinical Development
positions/1/description:
Established and led Animal Models and Pharmacology team of 5 Research Associates and 1 scientist. Directed the planning, execution, and analysis of all in vivo and downstream ex vivo activities within Moderna Genomics, supporting 4 research units by managing 100+ studies/year. Studies included candidate screening, PK/PD, disease modeling and biomarker discovery for novel gene editing medicines and mRNA drugs.

- Designed an efficient in vivo pharmacology strategy to generate high quality data under ambitious timelines in a fast-paced environment and pivoted quickly to meet company goals. 
- Collaborated with Gene Editing Innovation, Protein Design, Rare Disease and Formulations Discovery Units, enabling discovery of novel gene editors and lipid nanoparticle (LNP)delivery modalities.
- Interviewed and hired team of 6 direct reports, directed team in weekly team meetings and 1:1 meetings and supported career development . 
- Wrote IACUC protocols, worked with veterinarians and facility management to ensure compliance with animal regulations. Established SOPs and data storage and reporting system to ensure compliance and data accountability.
- Developed and managed budget and space allocation for all in vivo activities within Moderna Genomics. Oversaw expansion of animal facility, working with architects, contractors, safety, and facility management ensuring completion within budget and timelines.
- Sourced in vivo models and managed model generation at CROs to support research efforts in Moderna Genomics and other functions within Moderna.
- Established novel surgical models and trained team members in surgical techniques.
- Subject matter expert (SME) for metabolic disease/obesity/MASH, supporting target validation for Moderna Genomics and Rare Disease programs and enabling publication (Molecular Metabolism, 2024)
- Led scientific efforts to mitigate immunogenic effects of nucleic acid drugs, in collaboration with Immunology and in vitro pharmacology groups.
positions/1/title: Group Leader in vivo pharmacology  | Animal Models and Pharmacology | Moderna Genomics
positions/2/title: Senior Scientist | Animal Models and Pharmacology | Moderna Genomics
positions/3/company/name: Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health
positions/3/companyName: Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health
positions/3/description:
-	Led project team to elucidate regulation and physiological importance of transcription factor sequestration on lipid droplets. Understanding the feedback regulation of lipid storage has therapeutic implications for NAFLD/NASH and obesity.
-	Spearheaded in vivo pharmacology research projects to elucidate feedback loops regulating de novo lipogenesis and investigated anti-obesity effects of genetic and pharmacological DGAT inhibition (ELife and Cell Reports). 
-	Collaborated on neurodegeneration discovery project identifying novel clinical biomarkers (Nature Communications) and with Hotamisligil lab at HSPH to assess protein quality control mechanisms in adipose tissues (Nature Medicine).
-	Provided matrix mentorship to graduate students in Germany and Denmark, resulting in lead author publication in Molecular Metabolism and successful grant applications.
-	Successfully wrote grant proposals (~$330k), generated and adhered to timelines, budgets and milestones while mitigating risks in weekly team meetings.
-	Strong organizational skills: Managed laboratory inventory, negotiated supply deals, identified alternative supply sources, and ensured preventative maintenance of technical equipment to support essential experimental activities for 15+ peers
summary:
12+ years of experience in preclinical drug discovery in industry and academia in the US, the UK, Germany, and Sweden. Extensive experience in building and leading in vivo pharmacology teams to cross-functionally support PK/PD assessments, Disease Model Development, Efficacy Studies, and ex vivo analysis for multiple drug discovery programs in parallel. Deep understanding of designing and leading successful projects in diverse disease areas including cardiovascular disease, heart failure, obesity, MASH and immune regulation. Strong expertise with RNA therapeutics (mRNA-LNP, siRNA) and mRNA-encoded gene editors. 

Passionate about establishing and managing successful collaborations with internal, national, and international partners and CROs.

summary:
👉Follow me for insights of AI and agents in business 👈

Started in AI more than 20 years ago, Thinkers360 recently named Tim a Top 100 Thought Leader Artficial Intelligence. 

Follow this channel for:
► Best practices of AI usage in sales and communication
► Latest insights on technology in business
► Worth reading or watching: The latest international trends, statistics, videos, and posts 

✳️  You will get answers to: 
How does technology transform business? And how do I sell the change to my team? 

✴️ Tim´s Services (English, German, Spanish)
Public speaking, moderation (emceeing), presentation, consulting

✅  Currently Tim is mainly booked for one of these topics:
► #AI in Business
► Sales in the #Metaverse
► #Sales- and Marketing-Automation
► Sales-Funnel-Automation
► How Will Sales Look Like in 2030?


What will you get?
An experienced partner for your experiential and engagement marketing.

► Conviction:
AI and automation will not eat jobs but will tremendously change the required skill set. The deals will get bigger and bigger as sales have to sell a relationship, not products and services anymore. Technology is able to bring us back to the hero position where we once were. 

AI and automation are needed to gain the best brains, as nobody likes to do the job of a machine. 

► What happy customers say about his keynotes:
“Exciting and full of energy”
“Many other participants should enjoy a talk from you!”

📚 All of Tim´s books are here https://www.amazon.com/author/timcortinovis

➡️ You are keen to know about digital and automatic sales? Follow Tim here or get a weekly digest via mail https://www.cortinovis.de/blog/

Commonly used hashtags:
#staycurious
#ai #salesautomation #digitization #digitalization #digitalisation #salesautomation #vertriebsautomatisierung #rpa #ki #digitalisierung #digitalisierungvertrieb #rpa #roboticprocessautomation

Bio:
Tim Cortinovis, author, entrepreneur and speaker, was recently selected as a Top 100 Thought Leader AI by Thinkers360.  Fortune 500 companies' event attendees love his energetic way of telling stories that resonate. Since 2011, Tim has been traveling globally with keynotes and workshops in English, German, and Spanish to help companies use innovative technologies such as AI, the metaverse, or blockchain to grow exponentially. Among his clients are companies like Siemens, Avaya, ING, Arvato or e.on. He has worked as a TV news anchorman and  has a university degree in linguistics.

AI.FUND is an AI-focused entrepreneurial venture capital fund investing in future European AI champions to promote Impact AI “made in Europe” and to generate excellent returns for its investors. AI.FUND collaborates closely with one of the leading AI networks in Europe, AI.HAMBURG, and the AI.STARTUP.HUB to offer financing, business and tech support for AI-startups to accelerate growth and internationalization. AI.FUND is one of the only fully AI-focused VCs in Europe with full-stack AI-tech expertise. AI.FUND partners are experienced tech and investment professionals with a down-to-earth, high growth and return oriented approach.

summary:
"Some see what is and ask why. I imagine what could be and ask why not." (Pablo Picasso) ---

Business is at its best when it shapes the future rather than prolonging the past. My professional passion is to build businesses investing in people, technology and ideas that can make a difference. I see myself as an entrepreneur and change catalyst that drives long-term value creation, strategic growth & operational excellence: To stretch the what is towards the what could be. 

Some facts about me:
• Founding Partner of AI.FUND, a specialized VC fund investing in champion AI "made in Europe"
• Founder & managing director of Lakeside Invest & Consult, an international investor network
• Founder of Lakeside and Foodo, co-founder of Sailrs, Medialab, Gründerschiff, W3 Development, Luxshield & Palamo. 
• Ex-Operating Partner and Senior Industry Expert at Triton Partners (Private Equity)
• Ex-Member of the EU ops leadership team of Amazon, responsible for Supply Chain & Logistics
• Ex-Chief Manufacturing & Supply Chain officer (CMO) and member of the management board of Vistaprint / Cimpress responsible for Production, Supply Chain, Engineering & R&D
• 7 years with McKinsey & Company: Focus on Operations, Strategy & Finance in HighTech, Telecom, Industrial Goods, Utilities and Logistics

• Expertise in General Management, Venture & Capital Investments, Digitalization, Strategy, Operations, Lean & Quality, R&D and New Product Introductions. Additional functional expertise in Finance and Marketing
• Industry experience in e-Commerce, Hightech, Venture Capital & Private Equity, Printing, Semiconductors, Food, Telecom, IT, Logistics, Automotive & Utilities.
• Worked in Germany, The Netherlands, Switzerland, the US, Canada, Australia, India, China, Japan and various other countries in Europe and Asia

• First author of the management book “Capex Excellence – Optimizing fixed asset investments” 
• Ph.D. in physics on laser & quantum optics

positions/4/description:
The purpose of the programme is to formulate the objectives and measures to promote digitalisation in Finland. Particular attention should be paid to SMEs, increases in digital investment and European cooperation. The programme will contribute to the recovery of companies and the economy from the coronavirus pandemic. Finland was among the first EU countries to create a national AI strategy, on which the current programme is based. The programme combines AI technologies with a wide range of other digital technologies, such as the Internet of Things, 3D printing, robotics, quantum computing and virtual and augmented reality.

The programme steering group includes representatives from public authorities, companies and higher education institutions.
positions/4/title: Steering Group Member in the AI 4.0 Programme
summary:
I have over 20 years of experience of AI research at the University of Helsinki, MIT, UC Berkeley, University of Cambridge, and other leading research labs.

In the early 2000s, my work on AI-based wireless device positioning (2000+ scientific citations) was commercialized as the spinoff company Ekahau Inc. This led to a successful $100+ million exit (acquired by Ookla/Ziff Davis). 

My Elements of AI online course for non-experts (co-created with MinnaLearn) has been rated as the world's best computer science MOOC on Class Central. The course has over 1.4 million participants.

I serve on program committees of major international machine learning conferences including NeurIPS (area chair), ICML, and UAI. I have published over 65 peer reviewed scientific articles, and hold two international patents. I have given invited talks at, e.g., Google, Apple, Microsoft Research, Stanford University, Yale, Purdue, Sorbonne, the European Parliament, Club de Madrid, OECD, and UNESCO. 

Together with my research group at the University of Helsinki and collaborators, we develop new machine learning methods for a wide range of application areas such as cancer epidemiology, neuroscience, and astrophysics. I'm also actively engaged with developing AI education for schools.

Note: I will only accept connections from people I know or who have completed my courses.

headline: VP Engineering at LinkedIn
occupation: VP Engineering at LinkedIn
positions/0/description:
I lead Productivity Engineering at LinkedIn which includes:
Marketing, Sales, & Customer Service tech stacks
Developer Productivity & Happiness
Information Security
Employee Experience
positions/1/description:
People enjoy TV and movies as an important way to be entertained, but to also connect with one another. Netflix provides a path to do this by helping you watch fantastic shows whenever you want and as often as you want. Just look at the array of “Netflix Originals” we released in recent years.

But how does this happen? How did we become the premier destination to win that “moment of truth” when you decide to watch Netflix rather than doing something else with your time?

The team I’m a part of believes content creators should be focused on creating that moment, and not the bureaucracy of managing a studio. We believe in using engineering  to help them tell their stories. If we succeed, better content will be created and we will produce more Stranger Things & House of Cards. We intend to bring more joy and awareness to the world through creators.

We believe we will build the world’s most technologically advanced studio.

headline: Leading AI Products at Google
jobTitle: VP of Product, ACE (AI and Compute Enablement)
occupation: Leading AI Products at Google
positions/0/description:
Leading strategy and product roadmap for the AI and Compute platforms that powers all of Google products. This includes many different tools and layers of the stack, namely:

- AI Data: from human data annotation for pre and post-training to model and data lineage for GenAI data governance and RAI
- AI Model activation: tools and processes for model pre-training, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, orchestration, and model serving at scale. While we mostly focus on Gemini, we also support many other workstreams for models like Imagen, Veo, or Gemma. In fact, we also support non GenAI models internally.
- AI Frameworks: My team manages internal and external roadmap and strategy for frameworks like JAX, Keras, TensorFlow, or XLA. This also includes AI for mobile platforms now presented under the umbrella of Google AI Edge
- Compute infrastructure and efficiency: We own much of the internal AI Compute infrastructure and build efficiency tools to make sure we can bring the best out of our hardware and data centers.
- AI capacity planning and tools: Similarly, we model and plan capacity needs for all our Google needs across TPUs, GPUs, and standard compute.

Our team collaborates closely with many other teams at Google. From Google Deepmind on the research side, all the way to Google Cloud and our many product teams (Search, Ads, Youtube...)
positions/0/title: VP of Product, ACE (AI and Compute Enablement)
positions/2/description: Advising SCRM - Lidl Digital International on product, organizational and technical issues
positions/3/description: Leading company-wide Generative AI efforts across product and AI teams. This involved all the way from building the first LLM-based product feature prototype to designing our internal end-to-end Generative AI platform.
summary:
Leading the ACE (AI and Compute Enablement) product team at Google, building AI product solutions that serve all of Google's products, including Google Cloud.

I am a technical/product leader with over two decades of experience in leading and developing cutting-edge AI and ML solutions for various domains, such as e-commerce, health, media, and education. My passion is to create innovative products that leverage the power of data and algorithms to solve real-world problems and improve people's lives.

Besides starting my own company, Curai Health, using state-of-the-art AI to provide the best possible care to everyone, I have led teams in companies such as LinkedIn and Quora. I am probably best known as having started and led the team that built the famous Netflix Recommendations.

I have a PhD and deep technical background in Machine Learning and AI, and I have published over 100 papers in top-tier conferences and journals, and hold several patents in AI and ML. I have also advises and mentored startups to scale their AI capabilities and strategies.

headline: Passionate about AI and its impact on society — VP, Research, ServiceNow; Co-Founder, Imagia &  Element AI
occupation: Passionate about AI and its impact on society — VP, Research, ServiceNow; Co-Founder, Imagia & Element AI
positions/0/description: As VP, Research, I lead the organization's fundamental and applied research teams in artificial intelligence, with research activities in conversational agents, multimodal foundation models, causality, time series forecasting, large language modeling, and AI trustworthiness and governance.
positions/3/title: Co-Founder & Special Executive Advisor on AI
positions/4/description:
Element AI helps organizations make better decisions through advanced artificial intelligence. Born out of an AI research lab connected to the world’s top academic institutions, Element AI develops transformative AI business applications for large corporations and governments. Using our products, Element AI seeks to augment every decision. With a global ecosystem that spans North America, Europe, and Asia, Element AI has unparalleled access to two of the scarcest talent pools: world-class entrepreneurs and artificial intelligence experts. As testament to this valuable access, Element AI raised $102M, the largest Series A for any AI startup to date, just seven months after launching.

As Chief Science Officer, I led the organization's fundamental research team in artificial intelligence, with research activities in low-data machine learning, natural language processing, human decision support, and AI trustworthiness.
summary: Nicolas Chapados holds an engineering degree from McGill University and a PhD in Computer Science from University of Montreal, Canada. While still writing his thesis and jointly with his advisor Yoshua Bengio, he co-founded ApSTAT Technologies in 2001, a machine learning technology transfer firm, to apply cutting-edge academic research ideas to areas such as insurance risk evaluation, supply chain planning, business forecasting, national defence, and hedge fund management. From this work, he also co-founded spin-off companies: Imagia (www.imagia.com), to detect and quantify cancer early with AI analysis of medical images, Element AI (www.elementai.com), an applied research lab in artificial intelligence with a systematic process to connect fundamental innovations with commercial applications (sold in January 2021 to ServiceNow Inc.), and Chapados Couture Capital (www.chapados-couture.com), a quantitative asset manager. He holds the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation.

summary: Dr. Peter Lee is Corporate Vice President, Research and Incubations, at Microsoft. He leads Microsoft Research across its eight laboratories around the world. He also oversees several incubation teams for new research-powered lines of business, the largest of which today is Microsoft’s growing healthcare and life sciences effort. Dr. Lee has extensive experience in managing fundamental research to commercial impact in a range of areas, spanning artificial intelligence, to quantum computing, to biotechnology, and more. Before joining Microsoft in 2010, he was at DARPA, where he established a new technology office that created operational capabilities in machine learning, data science, and computational social science. From 1987 to 2005 he was a Professor at Carnegie Mellon University, and from 2005 to 2008 the Head of the university’s computer science department. Today, in addition to his management responsibilities, Dr. Lee speaks and writes widely on technology trends and policies. He is a member of the National Academy of Medicine. He serves on the Boards of Directors of the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence, the Brotman Baty Institute for Precision Medicine, and the Kaiser Permanente Bernard J. Tyson School of Medicine. In public service, Dr. Lee was a commissioner on President Obama’s Commission on Enhancing National Cybersecurity and led several studies for both PCAST and the National Academies on the impact of federal research investments on economic growth. He has testified before both the US House Science and Technology Committee and the US Senate Commerce Committee.

summary: Michael D. Schulz is an assistant professor in the Department of Chemistry at Virginia Tech. Before beginning his faculty position he was a postdoctoral scholar at Caltech in the group of Robert Grubbs. From 2014-2015 he was a Fulbright Scholar at the Max Planck Institute for Polymer Research in Mainz, Germany. He received his PhD in August of 2014 in Organic and Polymer Chemistry at the University of Florida, where he worked in the group Ken Wagener. He also received a Master of Science in Pharmacy at the University of Florida. He received his BS degree from the University of Iowa where he worked in the lab of Professor Ned Bowden developing a new method of site-isolating organometallic catalysts. He also conducted research on charge transport through self-assembled monolayers at Harvard University in the group of George Whitesides. His current research interests are diverse and include biomedical materials and devices, antiviral polymers, metal-chelating polymers, radiotherapy-enhancing materials, and polymerization catalyst development.

positions/0/locationName: Greater Los Angeles Area & Washington, D.C.

summary:
Ted W. Lieu represents California's 36th Congressional District in the United States House of Representatives. Ted is serving in his fifth term in Congress and currently sits on the House Judiciary, Foreign Affairs, and Science, Space, and Technology Committees. He was also elected by his colleagues to serve as Vice Chair of the Democratic Caucus, making him the highest ranking Asian American to have ever served in House Leadership. Ted is a veteran, having served on active duty and then in the Reserve for the Air Force. He retired from the Reserve in 2021 with the rank of Colonel.

Prior to coming to Congress, Congressman Lieu also clerked for the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals, practiced law at Munger, Tolles, & Olson, and worked at a financial services company before joining the California State Legislature. He also served on the Rampart Independent Review Panel and the Torrance Environmental Quality and Energy Conservation Commission.
 
Congressman Lieu served active duty in the United States Air Force and currently serves as a Colonel in the United States Air Force Reserves.

For more information visit: www.lieu.house.gov

headline: Artificial Intelligence | Innovation | Ecosystems
occupation: Artificial Intelligence | Innovation | Ecosystems
positions/0/description: AI.FUND invests in European early growth stage startups that base their business model on the application of Artificial Intelligence.
positions/1/description: We help Public and Private organizations and Startups to understand the opportunities of Artificial Intelligence in their context, building an AI strategy , Ecosystem and roadmap for the adoption of AI.
positions/2/description: GPAI is an international and multistakeholder initiative to guide the responsible development and use of AI, grounded in human rights, inclusion, diversity, innovation, and economic growth.
positions/2/title: Appointed Member of the Expert Group Innovation & Commercialization
positions/3/description: ADI Innovation is advising founders, managers, financial investors and public institutions in the field of new technologies  and artificial intelligence.
summary:
There are three major themes in my career: Innovation, Digital Technologies and Ecosystems. 
I am fascinated by the innovative possibilities of digital technologies, and how they can be implemented quickly and successfully through Ecosystems. 

For the past 10 plus years, I’ve been particularly involved with the topic of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning , how it gives rise to innovative solutions and the strategic importance of collaboration, strategic partnerships and ecosystems .

Current activities
With the AI.FUND (https://ai-fund.vc/) we invest in European AI startups.
I am the Managing Director of KI-Allianz Baden-Württemberg eG (https://ki-allianz.de/), which aims to establish a centre and ecosystem for AI in the state that is competitive and visible throughout Europe and internationally.
With ADI Innovation (https://www.adi.de/) and IBHO Management (https://ibho.de/) , I advise enterprises, startups and the public sector on the implementation of digital transformation and applications of AI.

In 2020 I have been nominated by the German government as an Member of the Global Partnership on AI (https://gpai.ai/), where I advance the topics of innovation & commercialization of AI with experts from 20 countries.
Since 2020 I support the German Federal Agency for disruptive Innovations (https://www.sprind.org/en/) as an expert for AI
Since 2018 I support the German Government in the development of the German AI Strategy.

Past activities:

Through AI.Hamburg I promoted the transfer and use of AI in companies in Hamburg and Northern Germany. Together with other AI initiatives, we founded AI4Germany to foster collaboration and bring Germany into the AI age.
At appliedAI / UnternehmerTUM, I expanded the AI Ecosystem in Germany and Europe.
I supported the Tübingen AI Competence Center and the Cyber Valley Initiative as General Manager with a focus on the transfer of AI from science into business.
At IBM, I helped to roll out the topic of AI and Watson Health in Europe.
For almost 20 years, I held various management positions at SAP. I introduced new technologies to the market (ERP R/3), built up the global partnership with Microsoft, helped initiate the global technology partner program, was responsible for the product portfolio in the public sector and built up strategic risk management (today Foresight) for the Executive Board.

summary:
Als ich 14 Jahre alt geworden bin, wurde mir zum ersten Mal schlagartig eines bewusst:

Viele Menschen leben unter ihrem Potenzial und können so viel mehr aus ihrem (eventuell) einzigen Leben machen, als sie es tun. Das finde ich sehr traurig und das Schlimmste für mich daran ist, dass die Gründe dafür meistens unbegründete Ängste oder gesellschaftliche Normen sind.

Diese Erkenntnis und der damit verbundene Schlüsselmoment in meinem Leben hat mich offen gesprochen nachhaltig geprägt. Ich habe mir daraufhin fest zum Ziel gemacht, nichts im Leben jemals zu bereuen, stets zu versuchen, alles aus dem einen Leben zu machen, was ich mir erträume und anderen zu helfen, das Gleiche tun zu können.

In der Uni versuchten mir Dozenten zu erklären, dass ich einen klassischen Weg gehen müsse, um erfolgreich zu werden. Ich habe die Uni nach einem halben Semester geschmissen und gründete mein erstes Unternehmen mit meinem damals ganzen Ersparten (3.000€). Vielleicht auch, um der Welt zu beweisen, dass es vielleicht doch anders geht, als es im Lehrbuch steht.

Auch wenn eine erfolgreiche Firma aufzubauen, dann doch nicht so einfach war, wie im jugendlichen Leichtsinn gedacht, durfte ich schnell dazu lernen und war mit 21 Jahren bereits Gastdozent in meiner damaligen Uni, um darüber zu sprechen, wie man als junger Mensch erfolgreich wird. Das hat mir erstmal eine gute Portion Selbstbewusstsein gegeben, auf die ich aufbauen konnte :-P

Aus dem kleinen Unternehmen wurde ein größeres Unternehmen und darauf folgten 5 weitere Unternehmen. Wir wurden zu einer Unternehmensgruppe, die mittlerweile über 350 Metaverse bezogene Projekte für Fortune 500/100 und den Mittelstand umgesetzt hat. Doch warum erzähle ich das?

Ich möchte eine Welt, in der jeder Mensch sein volles Potenzial auslebt, um damit sein eigenes Leben und das seiner Mitmenschen zu bereichern. Ich möchte, dass Menschen sehen, dass man mit 3.000 Euro und ohne Investor gründen kann und einige Jahre später mit einem Alter von 27 Jahren daraus achtstellige Unternehmensbewertungen resultieren können, wenn man an sich glaubt und bereit ist, die notwendige Energie zu investieren.

Aber ob man Unternehmer/in oder was ganz anderes werden will, ist mir dabei ziemlich egal.

Ich möchte einfach Leuten ersparen, mit 70 zu realisieren, dass man sein Leben und sein Potenzial aufgrund von schwachsinnigen gesellschaftlichen Normen nicht ausgelebt hat.

Unser Ziel ist es nun auch über Social Media unsere Reise zu teilen, um damit hoffentlich Mut zu machen, die eigene Lebensvision umzusetzen oder eben zu inspirieren, sie zu finden.

summary: The New York Times headlined: "When A.I. Matures, It May Call Jürgen Schmidhuber 'Dad'." Since age 15, his main goal has been to build a self-improving A.I. smarter than himself, then retire. His lab's deep learning artificial neural networks based on ideas published in the "Annus Mirabilis" 1990-1991 have revolutionised machine learning and A.I. By 2017, they were on over 3 billion smartphones, and used billions of times per day, for Facebook’s automatic translation, Google’s speech recognition, Google Translate, Apple’s Siri & QuickType, Amazon’s Alexa, etc. Generative AI is also based on his work: he introduced artificial curiosity & generative adversarial networks (1990, now widely used), self-supervised pre-training for deep learning (1991, the "P" in "ChatGPT" stands for "pre-trained"), unnormalised linear Transformers (1991, the "T" in "ChatGPT" stands for "Transformer"), and meta-learning machines that learn to learn (since 1987, now widely used). His lab also produced LSTM, the most cited AI of the 20th century, and the LSTM-inspired Highway Net, the first very deep feedforward net with hundreds of layers (ResNet, the most cited AI of the 21st century, is an open-gated Highway Net). In 2006-2010, he published the "formal theory of fun and creativity." Elon Musk tweeted: "Schmidhuber invented everything." He is recipient of numerous awards, Co-Chair of the KAUST Gen AI Center in KSA, Scientific Director of the Swiss AI Lab IDSIA, and co-founder & former President of NNAISENSE. He is a frequent keynote speaker at major events, and advising various governments on A.I. strategies. More: https://people.idsia.ch/~juergen/blog.html

Minnesota Doctors for Health Equity is a statewide coalition of physicians working toward health equity for all Minnesotans. We believe everyone deserves to live a healthy life, regardless of their race, gender, age, income, or neighborhood.

Health equity for all Minnesotans is possible when the root causes of poor health are addressed. Examples of these root causes include poverty, racism, gender inequity, climate change, and limited access to health care

positions/4/description: Working in the Laboratory of Mucosal Pathogens and Cellular Immunology at the Center for Biologics, Evaluation and Research for the FDA. Tuberculosis research is focused on developing novel vaccine candidates and in vitro assays for measuring TB vaccine candidate efficacy. Malaria research in mouse models are focused on characterizing the memory B cell population that confers protection in adoptive transfer studies. Additionally, our malaria work is looking at the role of TACI in a newborn model of Plasmodium yoelii infection.

Riess Tech Female Talent Recruitment Platform is the leading German management and recruitment consultancy for women developers. Our CEO & Founder, Victoria Riess, is one of the most relevant voices around women developers and technology. For her contributions on the topics of Women in Tech, Diversity & Inclusion and New Work, she has already been awarded five times as Top Women Leader in Tech and is also on the road as keynote speaker throughout Europe (25+ speaking engagements with 52,000+ attendees).
The success of her company is also based on this tech expertise. Founded in 2023, she built Riess Tech without outside capital; the company has been operating profitably since day one. She builds and leads C-level management and recruitment consultancy programs for women developers with global teams and renowned clients (such as Adidas, Celonis and BT Group) and helps CEOs on their way to reimagine recruiting.

positions/3/description:
RACE was an ambitious project integrating AI technologies into a robotic system. I have learned how to work independently, efficiently and effectively in a team which is:

* large(25+ researchers)
* multidisciplinary (Machine Learning, Planning, KR&R, Robotics)
* multinational(10 nationalities)
* distributed(5 sites in 4 European countries)
* working on novel and challenging(wicked) problems

I was responsible for executing the automatically generated plans on a PR2 robot. This lead to my deep involvement with efficient integration of methods from AI (Planning, KR&R), robotics and simulation.

Our joint work was successfully demonstrated in multiple scenarios. We have received a perfect score from leading authorities in their respective fields, our reviewers, professors Susanne Biundo-Stephan and Malik Ghallab. Such an achievement is extremely rare. 

The project has been also praised for exceptional synergy among partners, recognized by both the reviewers and senior members of the consortium.

I have worked on a map based social network called Nulaz (similar in concept to Google Latitude). Additionally I have also contributed to some smaller event apps, notably the official  Holland Heineken House developed to support the Dutch 2010 Winter Olympics team in Vancouver.

jobTitle: Professor for Digital Business and Digital Entrepreneurship
occupation: Professor, Aufsichtsrat, Keynote-Speaker, Moderator, Buchautor, Podcaster, Entrepreneur für die Digitale Transformation
positions/0/description:
Der Lehrstuhl für BWL und Wirtschaftsinformatik, insb. Digital Business und Digital Entrepreneurship verfolgt im Rahmen seiner Forschungsaktivitäten das Ziel, qualitative Problemlösungen für theoretische Fragestellungen im Bereich der Net Economy zu entwickeln. Hierbei werden sowohl singuläre Themen rund um elektronische Geschäftsprozesse adressiert als auch eine interdisziplinäre Forschung mit den klassischen Gebieten der BWL und Wirtschaftsinformatik verfolgt.

Die besonderen Schwerpunkte sind hierbei

- Digital Business und Informationsmanagement
- Digital Entrepreneurship / Digital Startups
- Plattform-Ökonomie / Virtuelle Marktplätze
- Medien- und Innovationsmanagement
- (Online-) Marketing und Neue Medien
- (Online-) Mittelstandsforschung
positions/0/title: Professor for Digital Business and Digital Entrepreneurship
summary:
Prof. Dr. Tobias Kollmann ist Inhaber des Lehrstuhls für Digital Business und Digital Entrepreneurship an der Universität Duisburg-Essen. Seit 1996 befasst er sich mit wissenschaftlichen Fragestellungen rund um die Themen Internet, Digital Business und E-Commerce. Als Mitgründer von AutoScout24 gehörte er mit zu den Pionieren der deutschen Internet-Gründerszene und der elektronischen Marktplätze. 

Für sein besonderes Lehr- und Förderkonzept in diesem Bereich erhielt er beim UNESCO Entrepreneurship Award „Entrepreneurial Thinking and Acting“ einen Sonderpreis. 2004 hat er lange vor Apple zusammen mit Motorola und der Telekom die erste mobile UMTS-App in Deutschland konzipiert und in einem Feldversuch im Rahmen der Kieler Woche getestet. 

Von 2013 bis 2020 war er der Vorsitzende des Beirats „Junge Digitale Wirtschaft“ im BMWI und wurde in dieser Funktion mehrfach einstimmig wiedergewählt. Von 2014 bis 2017 war er zudem der Landesbeauftragte für die Digitale Wirtschaft in Nordrhein-Westfalen. 2012 wurde er zum „Business Angel des Jahres“ gewählt und laut dem Magazin Business Punk (Ausgabe 02/2014) gehört er zu den 50 wichtigsten Köpfen der Startup-Szene in Deutschland. 

Die Redaktion von politik & kommunikation (Ausgabe 117/2016) zählt ihn zu den bedeutendsten Akteuren der Digitalisierung im politischen Berlin. Brandwatch zählt „Prof_Kollmann“ im November 2017 zu den TOP-10 der einflussreichsten Twitter-Autoren rund um das Thema „Digitale Transformation“ und „Digital Leadership“. 2018 und 2019 gehörte er laut der FAZ zu den zu den 100 einflussreichsten Ökonomen in Deutschland und hat „Gewicht in Medien, Forschung und Politik“. 

Seit 2015 ist er Mitglied im Aufsichtsrat vom börsennotierten Stahl- und Digitalkonzern Klöckner & Co SE. 2019 wurde er als stellvertretender Vorsitzender zudem in den Aufsichtsrat der COMECO GmbH & Co. KG, einem FinTech-Spin-off der Sparda Banken, berufen.

Unter dem Markennamen „netSTART“ bietet er seit über 15 Jahren einschlägige und begeisternde Vorträge und Moderationen für Unternehmen und Startups an, die in der Digitalen Wirtschaft aktiv sind oder werden wollen. Im Rahmen der "netSTART-Academy" baute er ein umfangreiches Aus- und Weiterbildungsprogramm für die Digitale Transformation auf.

www.tobias-kollmann.de
www.netstart.de
www.netstart-academy.de

Core contributor of the “Attention Is All You Need” paper (https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.03762) that invented the Transformer model. I also led scaling transformer models and extended it to other AI problems like Image Generation(https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.05751) and Computer Vision(https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.05909). Transformer based models can write news articles, poetry, emails, translate one language into another, and even answer questions. It has also been used in code generation, protein folding, speech recognition and many other AI models like ChatGPT, GPT3, AlphaStar, AlphaFold, Co-Pilot, Dall-e etc.

Launched some of the first successful deep learning based AI models for Question Answering and Text similarity for Google Search.
