positions/0/description:
Coach 2-4 group functional fitness classes per week of 2-14 athletes ages 14-60+. 
Create and execute lesson plans to deliver in class, including finding scaling options to allow every member to participate safely and effectively.

Provided a shoulder seminar in July 2023 assisted by PT colleague from P3. Seminar provided information on how shoulder dysfunction can occur and impact CrossFit performance as well as common self-management tools to improve shoulder performance. 

Completed a 25 hour internship of co-coaching, mentorship, and lesson planning.
positions/1/description:
- Provided high-caliber performance physical therapy, wellness, fitness, and prevention services to an active population in an out-of-network setting.
-Contracted hours included patient care, documentation, team collaboration and patient care transfer meetings, mentorship, research, and journal club.
-Special interest populations include injuries related to weightlifting/functional fitness, running, swimming, and performing arts.
-Alongside other staff PTs, I researched and delivered seminars open to the P3 community and public about pelvic health, ACL rehab, running related injuries, low back pain, and longevity. Seminars happen on a bimonthly basis.
- Crafted and delivered a shoulder pain seminar specific to the CrossFit athlete to my gym community, Croga Fitness, in July 2023.
-Developed an ACL rehabilitation program to ensure that athletes have a path of success returning to sport, including those that have already gone through conventional rehabilitation.
-Treated performers of the “Chicago” tour on-site in Feb 2024 to promote optimal performance 
-Initiated the offering of pelvic health services with special emphasis on the pregnancy and postpartum return to fitness in addition to ensuring pelvic health symptoms do not impact exercise participation for female athletes.
positions/2/description: On 9/30-10/1, I was a seminar teaching assistant for the Clinical Management of the Fitness Athlete - Live Seminar provided by the Institute of Clinical Excellence and hosted at CrossFit of Fremont in Newark, CA. This seminar educates physical therapists on how to manage injuries and performance related to fitness athletes such as CrossFitters, weight lifters, and functional fitness athletes. All participants are required to perform and coach other participants through the squat, deadlift, press, snatch, clean, and gymnastics movements. I captured media, provided feedback during lab breakouts, and assisted with overall operation flow during the weekend.
positions/3/description: Final 12-week clinical affiliation specializing in performing arts rehabilitation. I treated a caseload of 50% general population orthopedics and 50% performing artists (musicians and dancers). I assisted with youth dance conditioning classes, Hypermobility/EDS classes, Dance for Parkinsons classes, and the Garth Fagan Summer Movement Institute dance intensive. I choreographed a 20 minute full-body warm-up routine and instructed the participants at the Bonita Boyd's Artistic Flutist International Master Class at the Eastman School of Music. I also assisted with postural ergonomic screens for flutists to promote safe and sustainable body mechanics for the musicians at this intensive. I created an inservice about the PT management of Musician's Focal Hand Dystonia and presented the research to the other therapists at this clinic.
positions/4/description: I worked full time during summer 2020 and part time as a graduate student. I managed a highly busy environment, crafted personalized tasting flights, attended to customer service needs, maintained clean premises, and assisted with farm labor as needed.
summary:
Doctor of Physical Therapy | Coach | Musician

I am a Doctor of Physical Therapy with a passion for enhancing fitness and performance across the lifespan. With specialized training in treating both fitness athletes and pelvic floor conditions through the Institute of Clinical Excellence and the Herman and Wallace Institute, I aim to empower individuals to live, move, and perform at their best.

As an experienced coach in CrossFit, Olympic weightlifting, and functional strength training — and former USA Swimming coach — I combine hands-on clinical expertise with a deep understanding of athletic performance. I also bring a unique perspective to my practice as a musician with dual Bachelor's degrees in science and flute, offering a strong background in performing arts medicine, especially for musicians and dancers.

My clinical interests include:
- CrossFit, Olympic weightlifting, powerlifting, and functional fitness rehabilitation and performance
- Swimming and running movement analysis and rehabilitation
- Performing arts medicine, particularly for musicians and dancers, including hypermobility conditions

I’m dedicated to helping individuals of all ages achieve their fitness goals while minimizing injury risks and promoting long-term wellness.
volunteerExperiences/0/description: I played flute and sang for residents at Cayuga Ridge 2-3 times per month with other Ithaca musicians. The intent of the visits were to help improve mood and relieve physical and mental pain among residents through music and conversation.

summary:
I have been Professor of Corporate Management at the Berliner Hochschule für Technik (BHT) since April 2023. 

Graduated in Industrial Engineering and Management with a technical specialization in Civil Engineering (Dipl.-Ing.), I also head the two BHT degree programs „Business Administration &  Engineering - Civil Engineering (B.Eng.)“ and „Business Administration & Engineering / Construction-Technology and -Management (M.Sc.)“. 

I am also engaged as a lecturer for "Human Resources and People Management" and "International Management" in the „MBA Renewables“ program at BHT, as a management advisor and as a start-up mentor.

My professional and academic background - especially from the last 22 years in management consulting and in the BASF Group - is characterized by: 
•	vast practical corporate and personnel management experience from more than 25 medium-sized companies and large organizations in a wide range of industries,
•	the continuous development and transfer of my accumulated knowledge in the form of lectures, publications and conference speeches,
•	interdisciplinarity at the interfaces of business administration, engineering and law,
•	acquired core competencies and sound scientific expertise in corporate management, business transformation and project management, 
•	living and working in an international environment in Europe, the USA and Russia.

I am an enthusiastic and inspiring speaker at international conferences (Frankfurt, Zurich, Philadelphia, Charleston, Detroit etc.) on various management topics and author of numerous professional publications.

I hold a doctoral degree in Industrial Management (Dr. rer. pol.) from European Business School, Oestrich-Winkel (Germany) and studied Industrial Engineering at Technical University of Berlin (Germany) and University of California at Berkeley, CA (USA).

summary:
I am an agile project manager and embedded systems/software architect with over 25 years of experience in industries including telecommunications, military/aerospace, semiconductor equipment, and environmental monitoring.

My project management experience includes both Agile/Scrum and traditional management techniques, and includes all aspects of the project lifecycle, such as writing proposals, recruiting talent, interacting with customers, and managing budget, schedule, scope, resources, and risk.  I have managed multi-disciplined teams of engineers, both co-located and distributed. 

My technical specialties include Linux, VxWorks, C/C++, device drivers, data storage technologies (Infiniband, Fibre Channel, RAIDs, etc), bus technologies (PCIe, PMC, cPCI, VME, etc), and signal processing.  I have bring-up experience on several embedded systems.  My debugging skills are also strong.  I have recently been working with technologies including 10GbE, 40GbE, DPDK, NUMA, LTE protocols, and Deep Packet Inspection.

I have a BS degree in Electrical Engineering and an MS degree in Manufacturing Systems Engineering, both from UT Austin.

I am the owner of y2038.com, a website dedicated to helping with the Y2038 time_t issue.

Specialties: Agile project management, real-time/embedded systems and software, Linux, VxWorks, C/C++, bus technologies, DSP, high-speed networking, I/O, and storage.

headline: Professor of Design + Business
occupation: Professor of Design + Business
positions/0/description:
Faculty in the Rady School of Management and The Design Lab. 

Faculty Director, Design Education. 

Director of the Center for Design-Driven Transformation, which studies and teaches how large, complex organizations in technically challenging industries innovate and compete through Design Thinking and Design Doing.
positions/2/company/name: University of California, San Diego - Rady School of Management
positions/2/companyName: University of California, San Diego - Rady School of Management
positions/2/description:
As adjunct faculty, in parallel with full-time work elsewhere, developed and currently teach “New Product Development” in the MBA curriculum.

The course presents a process of research, synthesis and creativity that managers can use to guide their teams, and deals with issues such as opportunity-finding and product planning in the context of and as an input to a larger corporate strategy, framing new technologies to users, revitalizing stale product lines, and leading creative teams.

From alumni feedback, one of the most popular and immediately useful courses in the school, largely from its hands-on, real-world focus, taught from the perspective of a current, practicing executive.
positions/3/description:
Led and managed a world-class consultancy that helps organizations develop product concepts through Experience Strategy, and deliver on those concepts through Experience Design. 

Led the company through the recent recession without layoffs, instead uncovering and pursuing new market opportunities offered by the changing economy. Refocused the company's offering to its most profitable core, then extended that core from web to mobile, and from US to International. Opened its first studio outside the United States, established as a Dutch corporation built organically, self-sufficient and profitable from day one. Executive sponsor for European and Major accounts.

Led structural and cultural changes for ongoing professionalization of sales, marketing, operations and financial management, ultimately growing a $5 million single-studio operation into a $10 million company of 50 creative and support staff in three studios, with three distinct lines of business, and operations in North America and Europe.
positions/4/description:
Responsible for frog design in California. Led and managed a studio of 96 creative staff, prototyping facility, and corporate headquarters of 25, with P&L responsibility for a $28 million business unit. 

Oversaw all aspects of Physical and Digital product development, including sales, project planning, quality of deliverable, client performance, and team satisfaction. Justified, planned, and executed the unification of the SF and PA studios, with subsequent buildout and move to new studio space.
summary:
I help people and companies succeed by teaching them to innovate, and to conceive and develop User Experiences that customers love, delivered through elegantly crafted Digital Products, Physical Products, and Services. 

Long years of design-led business experience, from front-line team lead at IDEO to CEO of Adaptive Path, give the ability to unlock unrealized potential in creative teams, the insight to find unexpected opportunities in new products and new markets that out-maneuver the competition, and the confidence of having led whole companies to execute with that creative focus.

Personal appearances at events such as TEDx and SXSW, and publications and blogs such as Fast Company, have fostered the presence to express thought leadership on a national stage and to position an organization as a leader in its field.

A broad range of operational experience, from military command as a Naval Officer to General Manager at frogdesign, in the US, Italy, the Netherlands, and England, provide an extensive and varied set of management and leadership tools, along with a fine understanding of which approach will inspire and support the best performance from an organization in a particular context, gained by having been there and done that.

Leading and living change, from weathering the worst recession since the great depression in a high-performing and resource-constrained firm, to expanding a single studio into multiple studios around the world, to consolidating physical and digital design groups in order to elevate their work to the cutting edge of value, have taught me how to lead a company to thrive, rather than merely survive, in the only thing that is constant - change.


Specialties: 
User Experience Strategy and Design
Thought Leadership; Cross-cultural and Creative Leadership
User Centered Design of Physical, Digital, and Service Products
Professionalization and Realignment of Business Systems and Operations

I want to research and build cool things like robots that go to other planets or a rogue GAI that brings humanity to its knees, only to be saved by Christian Bale and a rogue-rogue robot.

positions/1/description: The CEDAR Lab (Collaborative Evidence: Developing Awareness and Research for Brain Injury) is based at G.F. Strong Rehabilitation Centre and affiliated with the University of British Columbia in Vancouver, BC, Canada.
positions/3/description:
Teaching duties include lecturing the bachelor in Occupational Therapy national program.
Research involvement includes studies focusing on cognitive rehabilitation for people with brain injuries.
positions/4/description: Duties included managing a complex caseload of young people aged 16-65 with traumatic brain injury, supervising staff members and various students and assisting with budget planning. This position involved contributing to multiple research projects in the brain injury unit and representing the OT department on external committees.
positions/4/locationName: Royal Rehabilitation Centre, Brain Injury Unit – Sydney, Australia
summary:
Dr. Julia Schmidt is interested in understanding life after brain injury. Her goal is to learn more about changes in the brain after injury and throughout life, changes in daily life and social roles after brain injury, and programs that support people with brain injury to lead lives that are personally meaningful.

Julia is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Occupational Science and Occupational Therapy at the University of British Columbia. She completed her BSc(OT) at the University of Alberta and spent over 10 years working clinically in brain injury rehabilitation. Julia earned her PhD at the University of Queensland, Australia, where she studied the effectiveness of feedback interventions to improve self-awareness after traumatic brain injury. She completed a postdoctoral fellowship at the University of British Columbia investigating neurophysiological function after mild traumatic traumatic brain injury in children and youth.
